Reviews.Title: “Great hot spring pools, simple, well maintained little oasis”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer64
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights and loved it, great place to soak in quality hot spring pools, which thankfully contain only a minimum amount of chlorine. The hotel rooms do have a pedestrian, motel simplicity that will irk some, but we found our room to be perfectly adequate, the bed very comfy, and we loved the quiet ambience at night, which made for long, deep sleeps. At the end of the day, I'm at a spa hotel like this for the rest, health, and relaxation benefits, not for fancy hotel room frills. I saw a lot of older folks during our visit, regulars who have been faithfully coming to Roman Spa for years. We, too, hope to make regular future visits. Other notes: The hotel is perfectly situated just off Calistoga's main strip, lots of great dining options a stone's throw away. In many ways this hotel, its no frills simplicity is reflective of the laid back, Bohemian vibe of Calistoga, which is the antithesis of the more snooty, more expensive, more artificial feel of Napa town. If you appreciate this distinction, you'll have no trouble falling in love with a place like Roman Spa Resort. Oh, and we loved the palm trees and lush gardens surrounding the pools and property; you really are in a kind of oasis when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sejalshah1977
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the only reason this place didn't get 5/5 is it could use a bit of an update BUT we would absolutely stay again - updates or not. Read on if you need more... We stayed the first week of April (1-5th). Roman Spa was delightful. The beds were very comfy, sheets and towels super soft and rooms very clean. Making our arrangements was a joy as everyone is so accomodating. The heated spa pools were awesome. Not big enough to do laps but plenty big enough to float about and enjoy the healing effects of the hot spring water. We stayed here because of the hot spring pools and mud bath. The mud bath was a total trip! Really glad I did it but not something I need every week. Everyone in the spa was very nice and professional. The grounds were very beautiful and well kept - this is such a great base to explore the northern part of Napa. We are in our mid 30's w/o kids. I'm not sure this is a great place for kids and families but that said there were a few during our stay and most were well behaved. Some weren't and I very much appreciated the front desk folks reminding them to settle down. The vast majority of the guests were in there 50s - 60s but as many of the reviwers wrote they probably started coming when they were my age. I would not hesitate to reccommend this hotel to anyone. Great time, lovely people, peaceful and serene.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marathon Recovery”
Reviews.Author: herfav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roman Spa and Hot Springs resort for two nights following my running of the Napa Valley Marathon. What a wonderful way to recover from my 26 miles and to celebrate my 60th birthday! The grounds are well maintained and our room, which was directly across from the main pool area, was very comfortable. My wife and I enjoyed soaking in the three different geothermal pools for hours on end. Each pool is a different size and temperature. She had packed some plastic wine glasses (great idea!) so we could enjoy some delicious red wines from the Valley poolside. The weather was beyond "good" and floating in the main pool and watching the palm trees sway in the breeze was the best! My legs have never recovered so well! We will return with our extended family members in that the hotel has numerous garden sitting areas along with the poolside areas where any family member would find their "favorite spot". We did not use the BBQ area this trip but did go a couple blocks to the supermarket and picked up some delicious sourdough bread and cheeses. Fill up the wine glass, tear off some bread and cheese.....think I'll go for another soak in the hottub!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: scott s
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort is Heaven on earth in Calistoga. The rooms are very comfortable, and spacious, the pools are always warm and relaxing, and the employees always have a friendly smile. The grounds are neatly appointed with flowers, wisteria, tables and chairs, and a BBQ area. The kitchenette rooms almost make the Calistoga restaurants a moot point--almost. Everything you might need is close at hand. We wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: RetiredPornStar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in October 2011 and we loved it. This is a perfect hotel to bas yourself at while exploring the local area and reasonably priced too. I particularly liked the enormous bed and outside barbeque area (gas and charcoal options with all utensils provided). We also used the steam room and pool which were very popular will all the guests. The heat is just right and everyone was very friendly. Calistoga is a beautiful little town and this hotel as I said will suit most types of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Yes.....”
Reviews.Author: chrissieF1459
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night here during my long weekend in Napa but next time I will spend more time here.... Staff where wonderful and helpful, especially as I had to make a trip back to get the book I had left in the room... The mud bath I would highly reccommend, I wasn't too sure about the whole thing but will do this again when I return. Carol who gave me my massage after the mud bath has magic hands, need I say any more.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhh.....”
Reviews.Author: Deborah Royat R
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort for over 25 years, and consistently find a helpful and accommodating staff, and exceptionally clean facility. The rooms are cozy, the grounds beautiful and immaculate - we go every February, with spring flowers blooming everywhere. It is a relaxing atmosphere, the pools are clean, well maintained and you have three choices for soaking away the day.

Reviews.Title: “...when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: After I regained consciousness following acute relaxation, I felt that I didn't dare to tell anyone how utterly blissful and beautiful and ROMANTIC this experience was - in the middle of February yet. The air was cool and fresh, the clear night sky was scattered with stars, and the tall palms waved lazily as my sweetheart and I floated warm and weightless with our neon noodles. Which reminds me of the bed and the soft white comforter and falling asleep with the light on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: My mother & I searched the Internet for a great place to stay for the birthday. Roman Spa Hot Springs Report looked nice. ....Well it was everything stated and MORE....., VERY clean, large rooms, beautiful grounds, and very friendly staff. We haven't slept as good as we did here, in a looong time. We purchased their wonderful pillows before leaving. The Mud Bath at the spa was spectacular, and the assistants were very friendly. I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place, and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “a quaint drinking hole with access to a hot pool”
Reviews.Author: roy w
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort offered a loud, obnoxious group to all who were seeking relaxation. It is impossible to have staff intervene. They offered ear plugs!!!!!! Unless you are looking for a place to take your buddies and get drunk and loud, stay away from this fraudulent pit.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: violetJoy
Reviews.Content: THE ROMAN SPA in Calistoga, Ca. offers a romantic, relaxing getaway in Napa Valley's wine country. Large, clean, comfortable well-appointed rooms at reasonable rates surround a large thermal pool in a beautiful garden setting. Two therapeutic pools and saunas are just a step away. The ROMAN SPA offers mud baths and massages and the helpful staff gives tips on restaurants and shops on Calistoga's main street, just a block from the resort. Across the street is a fascinating museum with Disney's Oscars and historical displays. Nearby are premium wineries, a state park and a faithful geyser. We return every year to the ROMAN SPA after the holidays and brought Seattle friends this January. They were delighted and want to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spa hotel for rest and healing”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: We just spent a day and night at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort and despite the current construction, the stay was wonderful and restful. The natural hot springs waters at various temperatures from 95 to 104 degrees were very soothing. In addition, to the hot springs waters, there were jacuzzi jets that made the waters invigorating. Inside the large room that houses the 100 degree pool, there were saunas for men and women. My only wish is that the pools were open for longer hours (beyond the 8AM to 10PM time period), but that was only a minor issue, and did not impact our enjoyment of the facilities. My wife and I received massages in the Spa and the massage therapists were very thorough and considerate of our needs. The hotel room was clean and the king size bed was very comfortable. We appreciated having free wireless internet and a fairly large choice of cable TV stations. The hotel staff was friendly and helped us get a 10% discount at one of the local restaurants, Barolo's. The half chicken in wine sauce was delicious. We are looking forward to returning for another visit to the hotel and spa soon,

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd trip...with more to come!”
Reviews.Author: Bsilly_12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from another glorious January trip to this charming hotel and we are, once again, simply delighted with the entire experience! We arrived early for our scheduled massages, went to lunch nearby, admired our clean, lovely room, and enjoyed our much-anticipated first dip in one of the three warm-to-hot pools by mid-afternoon...Ah, what bliss! We cannot decide what we like the most: the spa, the pools, the comfy mattress and bedding, the saunas, the friendly, helpful staff, or their numerous other guest amenities. The lovely gardens led us to investigate the gracious and well-planned barbeque/picnic area for the first time, and now we cannot wait to entice a group of family and friends to join us for a fun and relaxing trip to this welcoming location in the near future. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, quiet, always relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: Jill973
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have been enjoying the Roman Spa for the last 17 years. It's always quiet, walking distance to the quaint Calistoga town, and we love the pools. There warm, clean, and there's 3 to choose from. The staff in friendly, helpful, and the grounds are beautifully planted with fresh flowers every year we return. Can't say enough wonderful things about our favorite spa place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, relaxing resort in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole C
Reviews.Content: After thorough research, many phone calls, and much contemplation, a girlfriend and I decided on the Roman Spa last July for my birthday. We chose to splurge and purchase the Wine Country Wellness package. We did not regret our decision one bit! This all inclusive package exceeded our expectations in more ways than one. The staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to ensure our comfort. Our room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The kitchen in the room really made the experience, as we were able to stop by the market and purchase food for lunches. The package includes breakfast and dinner, but it was nice to be be able to make lunch in our room and eat at the tables in the garden. Even our spa experience exceeded our expectations. The package includes a mud and mineral bath bath, to which neither of us were familiar. Our bath attendant was excellent in ensuring our comfort and privacy. This was our first trip to Calistoga, and now, 6 months later, we have decided we can not stay away any longer. We have decided to stay at the Roman Spa again based on our great previous experience, and have booked the wellness package again for the first weekend in February. We cannot wait to have another amazing weekend at the Roman Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay & Rejuvenate!”
Reviews.Author: nsundy
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at Roman Spa almost every year since the 1980's and we love it here. The staff is friendly, the pools very warm & relaxing and the prices fair. You can easily walk the 1 block into downtown Calistoga for some very nice restaurants & shops or explore nearby wineries and other attractions. We always leave Roman Spa rejuvenated and happy!

Reviews.Title: “roman spa”
Reviews.Author: Michelle G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great the staff was nice and friendly the pools were as always warm and invitng my husband and i enjoyed our time their wifi was great and coupons to reastaurnts were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pav2007
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have stayed at the Roman Spa twice now and each time has been absolutely wonderful. The grounds are beautifully maintained each time we have been there and the pools are extremely relaxing. We visit the Calistoga area twice a year and have stayed at other properties in Calistoga that were cheaper, but the extra money spent to stay here is worth every penny even though the specials that they have are very much appreciated. We have not booked any spa services so I can't compare their services, but floating in the pool is so relaxing that sometimes a massage isn't even necessary. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no-frills, nice pool, good kitchen -- overall good value”
Reviews.Author: willCodeForFun
Reviews.Content: We had a three-night Thanksgiving getaway to this place. Although we disliked the bed, and wished that the DVD player would read the DVDs we brought, we found it a serviceable and pleasant place. We stayed in room 105 and it was an unusually well-equipped full kitchen -- good array of cooking utensils, oven and cooktop, fridge with freezer, a toaster and microwave, and a full set of dishes for four -- really well set up to take advantage of the fact that the Cal-Mart a block away is a great place to buy hot prepared foods/salad bar, a good budget meal option. There was a kitchen table with three chairs, a desk in the bedroom, and a largish bedroom table with two armchairs. Everything was quite clean and practical. The pools were nice, not as alluring as the ones at Solage of course and usually quite crowded, but nice and a comfortable temperature (the indoor pool was too small for much swimming). We appreciated the clothesline in the bathtub for hanging wet swimsuits, a thoughtful touch. The water pressure in the room was adequate in the shower, the showerhead was low for my tall husband but tolerable. Agreed with other reviews that the location, being able to walk to lots of cute downtown areas, is a major asset. No wired internet, they have property-wide free wireless that seemed to have good bandwidth but we had to log in over and over. The king-size bed was horrifically springy and bouncy, we didn't sleep very well as a result, and the radiator made really ghastly noises and was only minimally adjustable (always either too hot or too cold). Those were our least favorite things. We would stay here again for the value, though we wouldn't be all that excited about it. It's perfectly fine. We didn't use any of the spa facilities, just the mineral pools -- we went to Solage spa for massages (heavenly and highly recommended!).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite getaway”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor P
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa in Calistoga, CA is my idea of the perfect getaway. Its laid back atmosphere, wonderful mineral pools that leave my bones feeling like rubber after a long and satisfying soak, cheerful and pleasant staff and lovely surroundings full of exquisite flowerbanks and towering palms all contrive to lead me back there at intervals that never seem often enough to me. I'm a writer, and there's rarely a day when I don't fantasize about going back to that little Eden, so understated and lacking in the usual pomp and fluster that most hotels sport, it holds almost a magnetic attraction for me. My kids call it my obsession. I call it heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Best grounds”
Reviews.Author: cecilia a
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect; one block from main street, restaurants and grocery store. The three pools are wonderful, but the grounds are the best maintained in Calistoga. Very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: LKotsonas
Reviews.Content: I visited the Roman Spa twice this year; in September with my husband and in October with five girlfriends. The resort is perfect for a romantic getaway or a girl's weekend. The owners obviously care a lot about this property as every year there are improvements to the rooms, the grounds, etc. The landscaping, as always, was gorgeous with seasonal flowers, pumpkins and gourds. On both of my visits this year, it was unseasonably cool, but that made the mineral hot springs even more inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Richard V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the nights of October 26th and 27th. Checkin was great, our room was close by the construction but they did not start to later in the morning and then even then you could barely hear them. The garbage trucks are a little noisy but it is not that big of a deal, it helps you to get your day started a little early. We used the barbecue on our first night and they were so clean that they looked like they hadn't been used even though they get used alot. We spent most of our 3 days just floating in the pool and laying out in the sun, very stress free and relaxing. The rooms were in great shape, very clean, comfortable beds with lots of pillows. We did not have any issues with check in or check out, we were told 2 pm was the checkout time for the pool but it was not enforced, maybe because it was not very crowded. My wife and her girlfriends come up on an annual trip in June and the wife and I try to come up once or twice during the year. The attention to detail concerning the grounds is out of this world, they are constantly pruning, planting, and cleaning without ever bothering anyone. If you are looking for a party atmosphere this is not the place but if you just want to hang out and relex then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, quiet place to relax”
Reviews.Author: TourerOntario
Reviews.Content: We've been going to the Roman Spa as part of an annual vacation for 30+ years. It's a lovely, quiet resort within easy walking distance of the main street of Calistoga. The grounds are filled with flowers and kept in immaculate condition. The pools are protected and warm and can be used comfortably even in cool weather. The rooms are kept clean, and the bedding is comfortable, but the place is showing its age a bit, especially in the restrooms. I believe all rooms have a coffee maker a mini fridge, and some rooms come with complete kitchens. They are in the process of building a new wing, but at this point the construction noise is not intrusive, and we were given rooms farthest from the construction. We have found in the past that early morning garbage pickup off site can be very noisy. This time we were traveling with my son, his wife, and their 6 month old baby. They enjoyed their stay, but the rules about no child under 4 within the pool enclosure meant that the baby wasn't even allowed to sleep in his stroller near his parents as they used the lounges or pools. The mud spa and massage area is really showing its age and needs to be updated, though the attendants are very good. Lately, the resort has become more restrictive about check-in and check-out times, but we were pleased to be allowed to check in shortly after 1 p.m. and were allowed a "late" check out of noon. Most of the clientele is middle-aged or older. This is not a young people's party place, something we appreciate, but others might not. Overall, we continue to enjoy our visits, which are now always in the spring or late fall, and we would be disappointed to lose this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ellinad01
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested this place to me -- we're in our 30s and she'd stayed there as a kid. I was a little concerned that it might not be the same as she remembered. But when we compared notes, we realized: It was even better. It was safe -- very important as a solo female traveler. The room and the grounds were clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pools were pure bliss. The grounds were beautiful and well-maintained. I saw hummingbirds by the pool! And it was well-located in town which meant once I parked the car, I didn't have to move it. I could have a glass of wine with dinner and walk back with no worries. And the hotel is well-located -- I was minutes from the geyser, and several wineries. I also had a mud bath, a mineral bath and a massage at the spa facilities. The mud bath was wild. It's not the best smelling stuff, but it did leave me relaxed and my skin smooth. I left my visit there reluctantly, only because I felt so relaxed! I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Girls Were Back In Town”
Reviews.Author: PENChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We do a girls trip every year to Calistoga and we always stay at the Roman Spa. The resort is nothing fancy but is clean and a safe place for a group of girls to stay. The pools are just wonderful and some days we do not even leave the resort and just hang out by the pool. We love the fact that there is a kitchen because most mornings we just make breakfast in our room before going for a walk or a scheduled spa service. The Roman Spa is located in an area that you can walk to restaurants and shopping. The women that clean the rooms could not be nicer, they always make sure we have everything we need and even offer extra towels should we need them. I have read that people find the front desk people rude....I have never had this experience with any of the people at the front desk. They are always nice and have a smile on their faces. They answer questions and are always willing to give suggestions on things to do in the area. Perhaps the people that have problems may cause them because of their behavior. Yes most mornings you hear truck traffic early but this is to be expected seeing we are in a restaurant/spa area and not on a back side street. We don't let this spoil our day we just go with the flow. I'm looking forward to the changes they are going to make over the next few years, just changing the bedding made the rooms look updated last year. We will continue to stay at the Roman Spa, in fact we always book the next years trip when we check out.

Reviews.Title: “Another great weekend at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: bossyme1
Reviews.Content: My teacher/school secretary buddies and I have been taking a weekend pilgrimage to the Roman Spa in Calistoga, CA, "forever." Amazingly, it just gets better and better. The accommodations are so clean and fully equipped, and the grounds so pampered, we always have a relaxing, enjoyable time. With an outdoor pool and jacuzzi plus a large indoor jacuzzi, bar-b-ques, picnic tables and little groupings of tables and chairs, and steaming coffee in the morning, one can spend an entire weekend on-site if desired. We have many choices for our weekend getaway to the wine country, but we keep returning to the warm and inviting Roman Spa. We just love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Relaxation Amongst the Palms”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelDewU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I discovered this spot about 10 years ago and have returned 2 to 3 times a year ever since. We love floating about the mineral pool, gazing up into the tall palms above... The grounds are well-kept with beautiful flowers in the spring. The perfect place to relax and get away from it all. Calistoga offers several fine restaurants and is fun to just kick around in. We've also rented bikes (flat!) and tooled about... LOVE the Roman Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodations -- Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CSB_Edina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roman Spa for one night. They were recommended by the visitor center in Calistoga. The room was clean and comfortable, but was kind of your old style Holiday Inn type of motel where room entry is directly from the outside. The hot spring pool and hot tubs were very nice and comfortable. The staff of the inn did a great job of keeping it clean and well-maintained. The location of Roman Spa is excellent and within easy walking distance to several good restaurants. The town of Calistoga seems to attract the retired set, so don't expect much night life. My wife and I agreed we would definitely return to the Roman Spa to stay if ever in Calistoga again. The actual spa is a different story. We skeptically did the mud bath because of the novelty. It was brutally hot and kind of gross (they don't change the mud after each person and we tried not to think about the germs that were probably boiling in it), and we really could not wait for it to be over and get showered. The massage was very so-so, with it being more of a rub-down and less of what I have come to know as a real massage that gets the kinks out. The hotel tried to give an incentive to write the review here -- a drawing for a free night. Let me say that I am not writing this review to participate in the drawing, and I would not accept a free night as a result of this review. This is a nice, comfortable place at a pretty good value in this extremely expensive area of Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “Twenty-Three Years Coming Here...Reflections”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I discovered Roman Spa by chance on our honeymoon twenty-three years ago. We have been coming back since then (missed only two years out of twenty-three). The facility is everything one would want in a resort. There is a large, naturally thermal-heated pool, a smaller indoor thermal pool and a thermally-heated hot tub. Pools are closed by 10 PM and we have never experienced the pool filled with "Yahoos". Gardens, well-kept vegetation and palm trees are part of this hotel/resorts's elegance with six two-storey buildings containing spacious, up-to-date and ultra clean suites with either kitchens or beds and room only. We have always rented the double queen beds (I am a restless sleeper at the best of times and so two beds is a must for us) with kiitchen. The beds are to die for...firm and yet soft enough for comfort. We cook most of our meals and enjoy the wines, sun, heat and relaxation of the Napa Valley. There is ample parking that is free for all guests to use. There is also a spa run by the Roman Spa. The staff is efficient, courteous, always friendly and very helpful. What can i say? Our long record of coming here every spring, summer or fall of every year save two over the past nearly 1/4 century is testimony enough. Everyone from younger to older whom I have recommended this place to comes away awestruck...wanting to return again and again. My wife and I cannot recommend the Roman Spa in gorgeous Calistoga highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best Affordable Relaxation Location in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: kathy m
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Roman Spa in Calistoga for many years and returned again last July. I was happy to find that it hasn't changed at all- still THE BEST for relaxing and enjoying the wine country. The three different choices of mineral soaks are far and above better than any I have encountered. The location is one block from the main street with great restaurants and shopping. The gardens and landscaping are beautiful as well. I keep a picture postcard of the main soaking tub just to remind me of the great times I've had there. I go with my adult daughters for our "girls" trip every year and it is equally enjoyable with my husband for a romantic getaway. Most people I've met there are like me, have been returning for years! Kathy1826

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, quaint, great location”
Reviews.Author: Caspian99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the past several years (15). The staff is always accommodating, the rooms are always clean. Love the mineral pool and the location cannot be beat, right off the main street of calistoga. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a nice relaxing stay. The adjoining spa with mud baths are excellent for before bedtme. very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time and are eager to return”
Reviews.Author: Mom2940
Reviews.Content: I took my two adult daughters for a restorative weekend and we had a blast! The grounds are very pretty and well maintained, a wonderful place to relax. The room was super clean, really comfortable beds, and a well equipped kitchen. I recommend the Roman Spa Hot Springs without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobik1
Reviews.Content: we have been consistent and loyal clients of Roman Spa for over the last 7 years. We have brought over 20 people of our friends over the years to your resort as new clients. We arrived in the hotel at 5:00pm on august 6th, and checked out Sunday august 7th at 11:00am. We had my husband, me and my 10 year old son, as well as my pregnant daughter and her husband in the room we reserved. I had a spa procedure scheduled for Sunday at 3:00pm, and my family and I went to the pool to wait until then. At 1:20pm a woman ran in and started questioning us whether we were checking in or checking out. No hello, no smile, not asking kindly, she acted as if we were teens on a playground after hours. She spat out that we need to "get our stuff and get out," were her words exactly. We didn’t even get a chance to respond because she turned on the spot and marched off. At 2:00pm she came back again and with raised tones started telling us off for not following their policy with 1:00pm end of pool services. I explained to her nicely that I had a spa treatment at 3:00pm and ask if she could make and exception and let us swim another hour till then, on the grounds that we were consistent customers, we had not recieved any kind of discount, or special treatment, and ALSO there was only one more small family of 3 at the pool area at that time. To this she gave me an attitude saying "well do you see how crowded other resorts are?! its because of our rule that we are not so." My husband joined the conversation and informed her that the reason for other resorts being more occupied wasn't the rules, it was the price that is many many times lower, even for a day pass, then it is at Roman Spa. She said, "I have no energy to argue with you! I will make an exception, but at 3:00 all of you and all your stuff better be out of here!" As all this was going on my son-in-law was trying to tell jokes to my 10 year old son, so that he gets distracted from the situation and doesn't get upset, and as the woman was running off to the office past the pool she saw my son-in-law chuckling. She stopped, grabbed the fence and yelled "I want you out of here!!!" My pregnant daughter (his wife) approached her and asked on what ground does she have right to speak like that about her husband. The woman just yelled at her saying "and get that kid out of here too!" When she looked at my son she made such a face as if she had seen a dead thing!!!! My daughter asked to see the manager immediately, and she screamed that she would call the police! My daughter and I kept trying to ask why exactly would we be reported to the police and she screamed "I'm gonna go get a big man to drag you out of the pool!!" Here my daughter requested that the police be called so that she can tell them how this woman was threatening us with physical force. At this, the women finally let go of the bars of the pool gates that she had been hanging on for the last 5 minutes and nearly ran back to the office. At this point we had gotten our stuff, and I, my daughter and her husband went after her to the office. I requested to see the manager. She said "I am the manager!", I asked for her business card, and on the fifth time of me asking for it she finally shoved one at me with such a disgusting attitude that made me want to throw the card back at her face. She spelled her name out for me as if I was an illiterate. Her name was Pauline --. At this moment a man looking like a cowboy with a ring of janitors keys walked in the office and immediately started eyeing us up and down. He started cutting us off rudely and saying that it was time for us to leave, that we needed to leave, and that the best for us was to leave. Then he quickly opened the door for employees and went behind the counter, locking the door after himself. Then my son-in-law asked him what his name was and he refused to give it to us. Then my son-in-law asked him who the manager above Pauline was, he replied that he was. We asked him for his business card, he said he didn't have any. My son-in-law asked how could the higher manger of a resort not have a business card. The man replied "Do you have a driver license from Nebraska?" when my son-in-law looked surprised, the man asked "Do you even know what Nebraska is??" At that point we just turned around and left. Besides the ruined family trip, and the horrible feeling of unfair, unjust, unnecessary treatment, I want to know what exactly did my family with a 10 year old child, a pregnant young lady and her husband, and me and my husband do that was so criminal that we had to be threatened with police and "Big men." We had no alcohol there, no food, no toys, no music, my son was not splashing, jumping, or diving, and didn’t go anywhere near the adult pools. Now, it is obvious to all that $259 per night is not for the old room and old appliances, but we pay for the mineral pools. So to be limited on that after paying much, much more per night here than in an all-inclusive Marriott resort is just ridiculous!!! I am also wondering why after I had found over 90 poor reviews for Roman Spa on this site alone, most of which were talking exactly about the rudeness of the front desk staff, still situations like ours are happening, and Pauline flaunted at us the fact that she has been manager for 9 years.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I slept like a baby at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort. Our quiet room had comfortable beds and lovely bedding. Clean and convenient to all the restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rest and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: barbara47_11
Reviews.Content: This was about my 20th trip to the Roman Spa. I haven''t been in about two years. It was like going home. This is the best place on the planet to restore your soul. I always forget how wonderful it is until I get there again. It is welcoming, clean, the staff couldn't be more helpful and the other guests are interesting and friendly. Then there are the mineral pools. What a spectacular place to restore. Gardens are great and it is relaxed, nothing required but a bathing suit and willingness to enjoy. I will go back again in three months. It won't be two years again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebelliot
Reviews.Content: I took my granddaughter to the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort to celebrate her 17th birthday. My husband and I had stayed there and I thought she'd enjoy getting away. I am happy to report...She Loved It! Our room was spacious and clean. The people staying at the Spa turned out to be friendly, which was an added bonus. I was surprised at how often my granddaughter wanted to relax by going into all three mineral pools. Staff is friendly and helpful and most accommodating. The Roman Spa is only a short block from Calistoga's Lincoln Avenue so we were able to eat, shop and take leisurely strolls through the town. My husband and I did have spa treatments when we were last there and the service/treatments were good. This time, construction was underway as the Spa is remodeling. We were forewarned and the noise did not bother us as it stopped by 4:30 pm. My granddaughter wants to return and I know my hubby and I will be back for another visit. Can't wait to see the improvements and spend another few days in the mineral pools.

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Get Away”
Reviews.Author: RAB75
Reviews.Content: We generally visit the Roman Spa Resort about every other year. The Roman Spa is a great place to kick-back and relax after the hectic pace we sometimes find ourselves in, in our daily lives. The heated pool is very special to us because we can feel the tension disappear as we float and or soak in its heated waters. The indoor Jacuzzi further relaxes our tensions and is a good pre curser to a vigorous swim in the pool after a soak in the hot tub. The Spa staff is always very helpful and very polite and cheery.

Reviews.Title: “"We had a very relaxing vacation in a beautiful place."”
Reviews.Author: MKR5
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Roman Spa Hot Springs resort. The grounds were beautiful and very well maintained. There were flowers planted everywhere on the grounds. The patio area was very private because of all of the plants. The pool area was also relaxing. There was an outdoor pool and hot tub and an indoor pool. All were very clean. There were also grills for barbecuing. We were impressed with how clean they were. The room was clean with very comfortable beds. The pillows and bed coverings were of very good quality There was also a mini-refrigerator and coffeemaker. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed our experience. We would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and group friendly”
Reviews.Author: sta45
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the bed very "comfy". It has many patio areas and very nice landscaping that keeps pool and group noise down. One of the patio areas has well cleaned gas grills that you may use. There was some construction going on, but it was very low noise. I would love to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Hammers flying”
Reviews.Author: Hossca
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa is under construction. Had we known we would not stay there. The noise was very loud starting at 8 am. When the maid cleaned the room she left our door open for all to see our computer, iPad. Thankfully honest people were there. The shower head was so low our son had to get on his knees to shampoo his hair. He is 6'2". The shower tile was coming off. A great place perhaps 20 years ago. The roman spa has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: spadude1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very pleased to have found a mid-week "Manager's Special" at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort, which included mud baths for two. While the resort is not the most modern, it fits the character of the town quite well. The beds and linens were quite comfortable and offered two very restful nights of sleep. We enjoyed our mud & mineral bath experience as well as the three outdoor hot spring pools that are surrounded by well maintained gardens. The resort is located just two blocks off Calistoga's main street, which offers a good selection of cafes, restaurants, and even a local market for stocking up the in room fridge. Our favorite eatery was Boskos Italian restaurant, which was a short walk away and offers some amazing pasta dishes. We will definitely come back and can't wait to recommending it to several of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chubbsCarmichael_Ca
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Roman Spa for 2 to 3 days (at least 4 times a year) for 30 years, both together as a couple, with our family and with friends. The rooms are very well appointed, the grounds are well kept with new flowers blooming per season and the pools (3) are well maintained and very inviting. However this trip required alot more personal service than we ever have needed in the past. One of us had a medical emmergency during our stay and the staff and personal provided us with the best of care and concern. This is a public expression of our thanks to them for the efficient manor they extended to us in our time of need. A great resort and service all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be....”
Reviews.Author: chat2travel
Reviews.Content: We got the deal thru Living Social and it was a lot of fun. The king room with kitchen was great. The mud bath was not that comfortable because we had it when the weather outside was 100 degrees. The couple's massage was spectacular. The place is walking distance to downtown and grocery stores. As soon as you park your car in the parking lot. You will not need it again until you leave. The pool and jacuzzi was kept clean and the barbeque area was a plus. The beds were very comfortable and everybody was nice, polite and helpful. It was a very pleasant experience overall. I would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression”
Reviews.Author: chermanka
Reviews.Content: Had a solo mud/mineral bath treatment and really enjoyed it. This was my first time so I didn't know what to expect. The staff was friendly and accommodating; the attendant who looked after me was lovely. For what it is -- a place that deals with everything related to mixing mud, getting folks in and out of it, and ensuring that it doesn't look like a dump in the process -- it is a very clean, comfortable and inviting place overall. Not especially calm -- a lot of ambient noise due to plumbing and fans, and the piped in music was a little too loud in the mud room, perhaps because of the other sounds -- but at least there wasn't construction noise. I imagine if a couple or two friends are doing this together, they'll be more interested in talking. As I said this was my first visit, and I don't do many spa treatments. I did not anticipate that I couldn't include gratuity in the overall payment; bringing cash or a check for that is a good idea if you typically like to leave something extra for the attendant. I guess the mud is not for everyone, but I found it therapeutic. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.........”
Reviews.Author: roamingnoni
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another fantastic stay at the Roman Spa. I have introduced so many friends to this great place, and they all come away with the same feeling for it that I have... they hate to leave there and can't wait to go back. It is comforting to see the same employees there over the years and realize that it must be a fun place to work as well as to visit. I enjoy the 2nd floor rooms, but there are no elevators, so if you have trouble with stairs you may want to ask for a first floor room. There are also handicapped access rooms and kitchenettes for extended stays. There is some remodeling going on and I really hope there won't be a great deal of change. I enjoy the quaint, cozy atmosphere that is lacking at so many of the newer "resorts". Don't mess with a good thing TOO much.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: criticaltravelwriter
Reviews.Content: If this is a spa then a snack bar is a 5-star restaurant. The world's most expensive Motel 6 is undergoing some construction, so guests walk on wooden planks. But at least something is being done to improve this tired, rusty, filthy property that if it wasn't in overpriced Napa Valley would be $39.99 a night, not the $200+ they have the nerve to charge. No restaurant onsite and the pool was so uninviting we left our swimtrunks in the suitcase. Rude front desk, too. Unless you're desperate or have nothing else to live for, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds but skip the mud....”
Reviews.Author: darkbeergirl
Reviews.Content: We also got this deal through living social. It is a little old looking but I thought it was very clean and I am picky! There was some hammering during the day but no big deal. The beds were wonderful and the sheets were soft and clean which in my opinion is really a deal breaker. We got the mud treatment with the package and I hated it. My friends loved it though so I guess it depends. I thought it was nasty. However, great location, nice staff, clean rooms so not too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Living Social Deal”
Reviews.Author: PAB1120
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Roman Spa for a total of four days. They had construction going on as they are remodeling one of the buildings. So, there are a few construction guys walking about the premises, & somewhat loud at times. Got a good deal thru Living Social, but wouldn't pay more than that deal. Place is kind of out-dated. Daily housekeeping was timely. Beds are comfortable with great pillows, which they offer for sale if you inquire with the front office. But, the office staff couldn't answer why the standard pillow price is lower that the king size pillow price. Office doesn't stay open all night and doesn't open until 8 am. They do have umbrella's for guests to use during their stay should there be rain, and there was rain two of the days we stayed. So, that's a nice offering.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Girls Go West”
Reviews.Author: mzfletch
Reviews.Content: I bought a 2 night plus 2 mudbaths from Living Social. This was a surprise for my husband who was on leave from Iraq. I wanted something very relaxing, and we got it. I don't know what the normal cost is, but I got a great deal, so I can't complain too much. They were doing construction, which I never heard anything, but they did upgrade us to a King room with a kitchen. Now granted, the rooms were a bit outdated, but they are in the process of remodeling. The mudbaths are great. One of the only mud baths that offer couples side by side treatments. Everything was very clean etc. Just a FYI for those of a younger generation looking for maybe a party seen. The Roman Spa is not for you. I'm 42 and my husband is 53 and we were by far the youngest people there. I would say the average age is 68. Nothing wrong with that, it was very quiet and peaceful. The Spa is in walking distance to downtown Calistoga. We had a great time and would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “The mineral pools are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jadeacosta
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and hade a great stay each time. The staff is wonderful. The gardens are beautiful. The spa is very relaxing. Just sitting by the pool is peaceful. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Gail_Remillard
Reviews.Content: Roman spas always provides a relaxing and enjoyable stay. The grounds are beautiful with two mineral pools and a mineral jacuzzi as well. My sister and I love the grounds because of all the flowers and plants and pool side tables and loungers. The rooms are very comfortable as well and the town with shops and restaurants is an easy walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & comfortable in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Blueinak
Reviews.Content: This spa was centrally located in lovely Calistoga. The rooms were quiet, clean and the resort was nicely landscaped with a pool. At the spa I had one of the best massages I have ever had by masseuse Gina. I felt she really started the healing process on an injured shoulder

Reviews.Title: “soothing and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nicola2
Reviews.Content: A great getaway for the weekend. The rooms are clean and the beds are so comfortable. The pools are great and walking distance to the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Janet4808
Reviews.Content: The spa/hotel was perfectly located in the heart of Calistoga. Nicely appointed room, pools and spa on the premises. We had wonderful massages and mud baths and felt we good a good deal with the manager's midweek special that included a room for two and two massages. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The location for rejuvanation”
Reviews.Author: windytoo
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is an oasis of peaceful pleasure. The blossoming orange tulips and daffodils in their beautiful gardens entice you to leave your stresses behind and slip into the warm and inviting mineral water pools, hot tubs and sauna. If you want a massage or other treatment, all you need do is cross the driveway and enjoy. When the spas have worked their magic , you can rest in comfort in your room organized to meet your needs. The Roman Spa is one block from the center of Calistoga where there is interesting shopping a delicious restaurants to enjoy. I have been visiting the Roman Spa for 25+ years and plan 25 more.

Reviews.Title: “Always Reliable, Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Mann_Trips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and friends have been coming to the Roman Spa for at least 10 years. It's our favorite spot in Calistoga. Although not as fancy as some other Calistoga destinations, the pool-side ambiance, always fresh gardening, friendly staff, and great location make it perfect for casual weekend getaways. They recently updated the bed linens, so the sleeping comfort is awesome. We've tried other spas and hotels in Calistoga, but we always end up going back to the Roman Spa.

Reviews.Title: “DECEIVING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msmanders
Reviews.Content: Out dated and Over priced. Also has a carpeted pool area that sloshed when I walked-very unsanitary. I do not reccomend this place if you want relaxation or sleep. Walls are incredibly thin!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, Great amenities, outdated decor”
Reviews.Author: crazyaboutravel
Reviews.Content: We wanted a winter getaway. We chose the Roman Spa for its collection of water resources. Namely the outdoor pool, indoor Spa and Outdoor hot tub & sauna. The amenities are wonderful with your choice of different water temps in each water source. The staff is always willing to accomodate. There are outdoor gas BBQs for those who are inclined. The rooms are clean and the property manicured, with a variety of flowers and humming bird feeders to soothe your senses and lots of lounging furniture to relax in. However if you are into room decor, you will be disappointed in that regard as the decor is 70s and very bland. The mattresses are average, no pillow tops or luxury bedding. The effort is put into the outdoor aspect, but the indoors has much room for improvement. Taking that into consideration, I felt the rates are a bit on the high side. Unless you are willing to pay a hefty amount for dining I would recommend getting a kitchenette which will allow you time to lounge and relax rather than taking time to hunt around for food. The grocery store is just on the other end of the block from the hotel, very convenient a big plus. The property is the most convenient and has the most amenities in Calistoga. I know I've been going to Calistoga for a good 20yrs. and have searched other facilities. All in all, its the best spot in the area.

Reviews.Title: “dont be fooled this place is a nasty rundown joke..”
Reviews.Author: whoizadam
Reviews.Content: i am writing this review which is my first on trip advisor to warn you do not stay here. i know it has good reviews and the website makes it look really nice. this is in no way a spa or resort at all. the walls are thin between rooms, the rooms are overpriced and outdated, the "mineral waters" are some crappy pool and jacuzzi that dont even seem sanitary. I expected a nice stay with decent rooms and actual relaxing hot springs, this place did not even come close. save your time and money and stay anywhere else. dont say you were not warned.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay at the Roman Spa Resort”
Reviews.Author: cloumein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Roman Spa Resort several times over the years and always have a wonderful and relaxing time. There are 3 hot pools - one inside that fits several people, one smaller one outside and one much larger pool outside for swimming and floating - great to watch the stars at night in warm, lovely mineral springs water. We look like a prune when we're done - we love it so much. The grounds are always clean and the flowers and trees are beautiful - it's like being in an arboretum. The rooms are always clean and well made up, warm and comfortable. The spa is within walking distance of downtown Calistoga for meals and entertainment. This time it was a birthday treat for my husband and when we got there, they had put a bottle of champagne on ice in our room - it was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “One-stop Spa Vacation”
Reviews.Author: pfm32
Reviews.Content: Immaculate rooms and beautiful grounds with three pools for swimming, relaxing, and soaking and spa treatments within steps of one's room define the Roman Spa as a full-service, one-stop spa vacation. The hotel is within easy walking distance of outstanding restaurants. Numerous local wineries complete the package for a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: violetJoy
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort in Calistoga is a wonderful place to relax for a short getaway. It is one of many places with mineral pools from the natural hot springs in the area. Calisotga is a beautiful historic town with good restaurants and beautiful old houses --a fun place to walk. Roman Spa is in an attractive flowered setting with clean comfortable rooms and a friendly staff. The beautiful surrounding wine country of the Napa Valley features many wineries large and small that are fun and interesting to visit. Roman Spa provides a convenient and enjoyable primary experience within the larger stimulating environment.

Reviews.Title: “I always love Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: Phrannest
Reviews.Content: Very fun location -- most rooms have kitchenettes. The mineral baths, pool, and hot tub are my favorites. I go here at least once a year. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay helped me get away and enjoy Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: ybelinda
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Roman Spa for two nights and had a wonderful time. I grew up in the Bay Area and always remembered a first grade teacher who had brought back stories of mud baths in Calistoga (she also taught us sign language and the basics of massage!). The staff at the spa and hotel front desk were friendly and professional. During our stay, we enjoyed the mud bath, mineral bath and 1 hour massage combination package, went back to our room for a nap, then went out to St. Helen's for a nice dining experience at the Culinary Institute of America. What a treat the whole day was! My mom enjoyed the mineral baths and pool the next morning, and we did some shopping in Calistoga. The shops on the main street in town are less than a block away from Roman Spa, and everything was very convenient. Roman Spa also gave us a dining coupon for a few of the restaurants in town. We left with some wonderful memories and yes, bought 6 of the pillows featured during our stay (so comfortable!). Thank you Roman Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walk into town, must do pools, jacuzzi and mud baths”
Reviews.Author: kathady
Reviews.Content: Four of us, two couples, visited in December. We were on our way to Hawaii and our friends were driving up the coast and we overlapped in Napa. I had read the reviews. I knew it was a motel, had low expectations, picked it over some of the fancier hotels that were on sale in December because I wanted the pools, mud baths, etc. I was very pleasantly surprised at how nice the room overlooking the pool was and how pleasant the grounds and front desk were and how convenient the location was to walk to restaurants and bars. In addition, I had signed up for a manager's special on their website, 2 mudbaths for $99, usually $75 per person. Days before I noticed that they had a promotion that included the mudbath in the price of the room. I called the reservations and was again pleasantly surprised that they honored the new promotion for me. Most places would not do that. I thought this was great. My husband and I had their mud bath, which was one of the coolest things we have done. I had visited previously and did not do it and regretted it. This visit was much different from our last. Instead of wineries iin Yountville, this time we did sparkling wineries - Gloria Ferrer, Domaine Carneros and Schramsberg, the Safari West and mudbaths. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Love the mineral springs!”
Reviews.Author: debbies1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Roman Spa many times and have enjoyed it every time. Our stay last weekend was especially nice because the new manager seems to be giving the place an extra special presence, and it gives the place an nice edge. The ever present flowers looked wonderful even in the heart of winter! And of corse the mineral waters were great, (the reason we go), also glad the spa is now part of the resort. Maybe in the future we could pay for both, room and spa in one location?

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KBaldemi
Reviews.Content: My gal pal and I stayed here for a Girl's Night and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We had massages at Roman Spa, went shopping at the local boutiques and had a delicious dinner at Checkers Italian Restaurant, finished off with a relaxing swim in the Hot Springs swimming pools located at the resort. The beds are super comfy and the resort is very peaceful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Families magic place”
Reviews.Author: chubbsCarmichael_Ca
Reviews.Content: For 30 years our family have been faithful patrons of the Roman Spa. We have celebrated Birthdays, Anniversaries,and many special occasions with always great service, suroudings and friendly, helpful staff. We can not say enough good things about this wonderful place. Thank you for asking us to write a review. Our rooms were close to the spa, pools, resturants and a kitchen of our own stocked with utensils, condiments, serving dishes, barbarque and lovely furnishings. A great time was had be all!

Reviews.Title: “I had the most relaxing weekend.”
Reviews.Author: smmcconnell
Reviews.Content: Left work a little early on Friday afternoon - picked up 2 girlfriends and hit the road. Easy drive to Napa Valley - did a little wine tasting on the way. Easy check in at the Roman Spa, parked the car and didn't have to use it for the rest of the weekend. Got unpacked, changed into swimsuits and hit the mineral pools for a soak. The grounds were beautiful, rooms are neat and clean. Comfortable beds. We had a room with a kitchenette so we saved money by eating in. We walked to the grocery store only 2 blocks away. The resort is one block off Calistoga's main street with great shops and restaurants. Booked a mini bliss treatment in their spa for the next day. It was wonderful and after it was over went back to soak in the pools. It doesn't get better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient place to call home for a couple days.”
Reviews.Author: pupchurch
Reviews.Content: The resort was a pleasant and convenient place to call home for a couple of days while tasting our way through the wine country. The rooms were clean and and spacious, and I have no complaints regarding our stay. We didn't get to enjoy the grounds very much as it poured rain the entire weekend. However that didn't stop us from enjoying the hot tub and pool. We also enjoyed a mineral bath at the spa before departing. The water was a little too hot, but it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort is Great!”
Reviews.Author: reow1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roman Spa hotel on a recent visit to Napa Valley. The hotel is an older hotel that has been updated and is very clean. The pools and hot tubs are fantastic. I could have spent all day in the regular pool which is 92 degrees all the time from hot springs. They also have a lot of really nice community seating areas and grills for customers to use. The location is excellent as well. The hotel is located within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The hotel is an excellent value in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: valhappy1
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an upscale, modern place - this is not for you. But if you're looking for a comfortable, inviting, nice place to stay - definitely give it a try! Rooms are modest, but clean and very comfortable. The pools, although somewhat small, are warm and very relaxing (not to mention open 8am - 10pm, so a perfect way to start or end a day!). The grounds are lovely - plenty of places to lounge, with plants and flowers all over the place. It reminded me a bit of the setting of Melrose Place (the original 90s version), but in a very good way! The women at the front desk, as well as the housekeeping staff, were hospitable and charming. Overall, a very wonderful stay - would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “another fun experience”
Reviews.Author: 4sioux
Reviews.Content: Our group of five comes here several times a year for the hot water and good times. Staff is always nice and our suite of two rooms adequate. We have a grand time - lots of good restaurants within a block of walking, an outdoor and indoor pool and a jacuzzi to choose from to relax in and the place is well-maintained with lots of flowers. Price could be cheaper, but can't do much about that.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: SoFloridaGuy
Reviews.Content: This is probably my fifth time to stay at this little gem. Once I get into Calistoga, the work world seems to disappear. And by the time I check into the Roman Spa, my breathing slows and I genuinely relax. That is why I continue to return. The Roman Spa is not a new property, but it is very well maintained. The gardens are inviting and always impeccable. The hummingbirds buzz around drinking from the feeders under the arbor, and from the flowers around the property. Our room overlooked the arbor and the pool, with a great view of the distant hills in the East. The pool is the ‘main attraction’ for us. After flying over 2,600 miles from south Florida, the warm pool is a GREAT way to rejuvenate before going out for dinner. If you have never stayed in an area with spring fed pools this is a wonderful introduction for you. You feel almost primeval soaking in the Earth warmed water - you really just relax. On other trips we have been here in January, and even then it is an awesome experience to float in the warm water. Whether it is something in the water (minerals) or just the temperature, you will be delighted. Everything is a very convenient walk from the hotel. If you want picnic supplies, a sandwich or a hot meal to go, try Cal-Mart about a block away. This is a full service grocery which is locally owned and operated. You can also find snacks to take along as you visit the wineries during the day. There are also bakeries for breakfast, a cantina for lunch and PLENTY of options for dinner. Again, all within walking distance. If you have not been to the California Wine Country before, Calistoga is a perfect location for day trips to both the Napa and Sonoma Valleys. You can go in any direction and find top-notch wineries; from a larger commercial level to ‘Mom and Pops’ who will take you on walking tours and explain the wine process to you. Also look into the olive oil producers, i.e. Dutch Henry, it is a great item to bring home and re-live your Wine Country experience once you return. The Roman Spa is THE PLACE to stay, and we will be back. (This review is over-due. We took this trip to get away from work. But once we returned, the work routine caught up with us. We wish we were back there already.)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dfrohlich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in town and has it's own spa called the Baths. Love their mineral bath and massages. The best thing about the Roman spa is the mineral pool and therapy spa. We love to go down after dinner and hang out in the pool, it is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Love it so much we just keep going back”
Reviews.Author: PENChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We do a girls trip every year and the place we go back to year after year is The Roman Spa. The rooms are great (this year they had wonderful new bedding) and the pool and surounding area just can't be beat. 3 wonderful mineral pools, each a different tempture is the perfect way to begin or end the day. It is the perfect atmosphere to sit and read a book, listen to your ipod or just soak away all your troubles. Having a kitchen in your room makes it easy to have light meals and snacks. Calistoga is a great little town and The Roman Spa is right in the middle of it making easy access to spas, resturants and shopping a breeze. It is also easy to vist Napa or other towns by a short car or bike ride. The staff from the front desk to the housekeeping are just wonderful and very helpful. There is a reason why almost every person you meet there is a repeat visitor year after year. In fact I always book the next years trip when I check out that is how sure we all are that we will continue to return every year. We will continue to return and I will continue to recommend The Roman Spa to anyone that is planning a visit to the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: roamingnoni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited the Roman Spa annually for the last four years. This past week my friend from Chicago came out for the second time to visit this idyllic spot with me. It is hard to describe how relaxing and rejuvenating it feels to soak in their series of mineral pools. Whether basking in the Wine Country sun or gazing at the stars above the rustling palm trees surrounding the pool and spa, one can drift in the luscious waters for hours. Among the lovely flowering gardens, hummingbirds hover and dart about. Friends, old and new, marvel at the serenity. Couples murmur in a variety of languages, but the appreciation for this experience seems universal. We heard lots of comments about the comfy beds, too. The onsite Spa offers a full range of head-to-toe services. I had an amazing deep-tissue massage by a diminutive lady named Gina, who had such strong healing hands that I had to return the next day for an encore. Besides the friendly staff and warm atmosphere, I love the convenient location. We are able to park there and walk to everything we could possibly want within 4 or 5 blocks--fine as well as casual dining, great wines, groceries, and of course for our girls' trip--SHOPPING! Many of the rooms have kitchenettes that are bonus for an extended stay. My husband and I like to shop CalMart(2 blks away) for fresh seafood to grill in one of the courtyard areas. CalMart has a wide array of wine/deli offerings, including one of the largest cheese selections ever, along with fresh produce and baked treats. I suppose this is not a "resort" in the sense of not having onsite restaurant/room service, poolside service, or plush robes in the closet. I have checked out every other hotel in the vicinity that offers onsite spa services and mineral pools. So far, all things considered, I won't be going anywhere else. Check out their specials throughout the year at www.romanspahotspringsresort.com

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST LITTLE SPA IN THE AREA”
Reviews.Author: bossyme1
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed in two other spas in Calistoga over the years, and since we discovered The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort, we have looked no further. For the value, the location, the amenities, the cleanliness, the service, the friendliness of the managers and staff, this spa cannot be touched...It is true gem. We are already booked for next fall.....

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing - will return”
Reviews.Author: windwardway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an anniversary weekend at the Roman Spa. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and both the rooms and grounds were clean and well maintained. Three pools fed by natural hot springs and kept at different temperatures are the attraction, together with the spa. In addition to enjoying the pools all weekend, we treated ourselves to a mud bath and mineral bath. Ahhh!

Reviews.Title: “Quality time with my daughter at a tranquil, serene resort hideaway!”
Reviews.Author: Keezman
Reviews.Content: I'm very fortunate that this is my third visit to one of Calistoga's premier spa resorts. The grounds were breathtaking and filled with beautiful flowers and koi ponds. We were able to have a picnic by the pool after a wonderful morning in the spa decompressing from our daily lives. The central location makes Calistoga dining and shopping a breeze! Looking forward to visit #4!...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Not my style but very nice staff. Left...”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Hong
Reviews.Content: Not my style but very nice staff. Left because too loud. Could hear everything from conversations of neighbors and outside to washing hands. Old rustic rooms that were very clean. The Internet made me think it would be more lush. Good for families bit not for a relaxing, romantic getaway. Their mudbath spa was terrific though.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Hot Springs, A Hot Mess!!!!”
Reviews.Author: queenie28
Reviews.Content: The staff at Roman Hot Springs, especially the maintenance man and maids are really super nice, helpful, efficient people except for the receptionist (Barbara) who acted like I was interupting her computer time.........that being said, immediately upon checking in and going to my room the dead bolt did not work, couldn't call out on room phone but did hear a dial tone, regular lock on door was tricky and I had to go to the lobby without locking my door, staff fixed dead bolt, replaced phone, and showed me the trick to locking regular lock, the room was as stuffy as they come and the air conditioner would shut off at randoms times, either too cold or too hot, I have never heard so much loud partying in the courtyard below my room, this went on until 10:00, this was anything but a relaxing resort, it was more of a loud motel, no room service, expensive, and just plain crappy..........................don't stay at Roman Hot Springs if your looking to relax....and another thing, the massage therapist are a little too friendly for comfort at The Baths, if your a female, request a female, the male masseuse I had at The Baths was a bit too friendly and talkative....I had more political commentary and his general views on just about everything then I really wanted to hear.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you are expecting a basic hotel, rather than a spa resort”
Reviews.Author: FairReviewerOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: REVIEW OF THE HOTEL AND POOLS (FOR SPA, SEE BELOW) I have been here twice, once in winter (February 2009) with my husband, and more recently with a girlfriend (August 2010). I would say that this would not be my first choice in Napa Valley or just Calistoga if I was looking for a treat, for a spa weekend, or for a luxurious Wine Country vacation. This is one of the best deals you can get for the location and if you were expecting a basic hotel or motel (basic Best Western or Motel style), you will be satisfied with the Roman Spas. If instead you were expecting what the hotel name conveys "Roman Spa Resort" then you might be disappointed. From my experience, this place is much better in summer than winter. It's nice to get in the warm and hot waters of the pools during each season, but in winter, the hot spring water creates a lot of steam and a little smell of spring water in the air. In summer, there is no steam at all and the pools look a lot nicer. In summer you can also take advantage of the various courtyards on the property, each with some tables + umbrella, lounge chairs, and 2-3 barbeques. I saw that the cleaning crew cleaned each barbeque in the morning. The place is pretty well kept. The rooms are well taken care of. Basic, but comfortable. Basic bathroom, but good water pressure. I found the bed to be comfortable and with lots of fluffy pillows. Some units have a kitchenette that is stocked with most things you would need to prepare breakfast or an easy dinner. We did not cook, but I checked into the cabinets. During the August stay, there was a bachelorette party in or near our building and that created a lot of noise. If it wasn't because i was too tired to get up, I would have complained with the front desk. I would recommend this to couples or groups of friends that are looking for a hotel with a pool that is good value in a good location. Do not go if you are looking for a quiet and romantic setting. I would NOT recommend the Spa. REVIEW OF THE SPA: My husband bought me a massage and facial as a gift in February 2009. While the idea was great and I really appreciated it, there was no way he would have known how bad the experience was going to be. First of all, the location is like a permanent trailer on the other side of the hotel's parking lot. Secondly, the staff is friendly but not professional. The facial sucked and the massage was horrible. In fact, the massage was so horrible that I felt disgusted more than relaxed afterwards. The male masseur kept complimenting me on my muscle tone and mentioned a few times how "beautiful" I was. Was he expecting this to increase his tip?! I felt like it was cheesy and extremely unprofessional for someone to keep making such personal comments while rubbing their hands on me. Anyway - don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculately clean, great thermal pools”
Reviews.Author: alittledabble
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from the Roman Spa since it's a motel and the rooms are a little bit older; however, I had a lovely stay. It was the best value we could find for the high season and my friend lives nearby and goes a lot. While yes, the rooms / bathrooms could use an upgrade, once I was there it really wasn't a detractoin and honestly i just didn't care. The place is immaculately clean. I even walked by and saw them cleaning the public bbq's and they just gleamed they were so clean. I seriously want to know their secrets. The grounds/gardens are just lovely as well and the pools are perfect. Three different pools with different temperatures, each just right! The photos here on tripadvisor really do give a good sense of this hotel. I did wish there was an iron in the room however (since lots of people on vacation in napa indulge in high end dining) rather than having to ask for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls getaway”
Reviews.Author: freemaryjane
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided it was time for a little rnr awy from it all. After searching allover online we decided on roman hot springs based on a friends recommandation. The price was right, the rooms were clean and very comfortable, and the mineral pools made the deal that much sweeter. Three different temp pools to splash around in and relax. The location was great just off the main street and close to everything. We had an amazing time and didn't want to leave. Fantastic wine tasting throughout the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, comfortable accomodation, and perfect mineral water pools”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyTraveler10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to stop by Calistoga but with no location in mind. After making several calls to hotels, Roman Spa gave us the best deal. The room was large and comfortable, and came with a small kitchen corner which is great for a 2-3 day stay. The bathroom is clean as well. Service is great. There are swimming pools: an outdoor and an indoor (and a sauna). The water is treated with special methods as it is mineral water. It is in the heart of Calistoga's main restaurants, galleries, and bars. Would stop by here again.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: mabaxman
Reviews.Content: the bed (mattresss) was very comfortable and had a great nights sleep. the grounds were beautiful and well maintained. the pools were very nice and used them both during the day and evening. the spa was wonderful at the resort and enjoyed my first mud and mineral bath. would highly recommend the stay to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: FortBragg_CAMusic
Reviews.Content: It's a great place to relax and enjoy the mineral spas. The grounds are beautiful and they offer barbeque grills for those who want to cook for themselves. Some rooms have kitchens and they are well furnished with plates, wine glasses - anything you need. This is the place we come to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for a relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: tikirico
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest finds in Napa Valley is the Roman Spa. It is located right off the heart of town, central to food/shopping and 10 minutes from wineries.. But most of all, it is extremely inviting, the pools are immaculate, clean, warm and never overly crowded. The grounds are very well maintained, with beautiful flowers, and waterfalls all throughout. I discovered this place a few years ago, and try and make it my little getaway twice a year to become relaxed, and rejuvenated. Once I spend a few days up hear in the mineral waters, relaxing, I am ready to face the world again. And it is always best to spend a little more to get a room with a small kitchen. This is well worth the few extra bucks, for the convenience of extra space and a refrigerator, stove, microwave and nice kitchen table.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect escape from the rat race...”
Reviews.Author: RixxM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been regulars at the Roman Spa for years now and are consistently pleased with the service, quality, and amenities. We tried another similar spa/hotel in the area and were not impressed. We enjoy the intimate feel, the older clientele, the warm springs pool (floating with noodles and staring up at the palms and stars).....and the great location. Everything needed is within walking distance--the Cala Market to stock up on snacks for the room fridge, fine/casual dining (we like Checkers and the Calistoga Inn), and cute boutique shops for browsing......the Hydro Bar & Grill is just one block away and a fun stop for a bite and/or brew...... I'd highly recommend the Roman Spa for anyone who wants a laid-back, relaxing getaway......

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go there again!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie024
Reviews.Content: What a great place! As soon as we entered the grounds, we were enveloped by the heady fragrance of orange blossoms and wisteria. The landscaping is lovely, with blooming plants and fountains and plenty of lounge chairs and tables tucked around the walkways and in the pool area. The pools were sparkling clean, and hot! The hotel provides robes and flip-flops if you ask. I enjoyed floating around for hours smelling the orange blossoms and seeing the stars through the palm trees at night. The vibe here is definitely laid back and welcoming to people of all ages and sizes--no need to be self-conscious in a swimsuit. The rooms are air-conditioned and well maintained and the beds are comfortable. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Name for a Not So Fancy Place”
