Their kind service apparently didn't include new towels after 1 day, or new shampoo (which was so cheap I wouldn't even use it on my pets), we didn't even get our cups washed or replaced, just left in the sink. But on the bright side, our queen and twin beds were made when we returned to our "resort". The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort boasts on their website: "This delightful hotel and hot springs resort is a unique blend of Napa Valley style and warm hospitality in a captivating locale." They should really rephrase this on their website to read "our MOTEL hasn't had any upgrades since the 70's, our staff doesn't even know how to spell the words customer service, so don't expect a lot, our enchanting garden boasts potted flowers from the dollar store, our ice machine is on the fritz indefinitely, our thin walls make for a cozy experience with your neighbor, but hey- at least we only charge $225.00 a night! Enjoy your stay and don't mind the manager's building out back with the wood scraps dangling off the balcony! Needless to say, I will NEVER return to this tourist trap again and I hope that by reading this I'm saving your wallet too! Forget staying in Calistoga- come here for dinner at Brannan's (INCREDIBLE FOOD) but sleep and spa in Sonoma!! Make yourself and your mother in-law happy, trust me...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kga19
Reviews.Content: My friend chose Roman Spa for a girls weekend getaway. The hotel is super close to restaurants and shopping and we walked everywhere. I liked the pools, gardens and fountains. It was very comfortable and clean, and we plan to stay there again next year! A really good value!

Reviews.Title: “Luscious Hot Springs at Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: Rockfordpeach
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Roman Spa for the second time. We rented the room closest to the pool, which has a small but perfectly adequate kitchen. The rooms are clean and comfy. The hot spring pools are to die for. You have your choice of 3 pools-one 1960's style outdoor pool, and indoor pool with jaccuzzi jets and an outdoor hot tub which to me was too hot for my comfort, but others seemed to really enjoy it. The weather was dry and hot, and I felt like I was in Palm Springs, with all the palm trees around. The pools contain water from the underground hot springs and the water is particulary soft and luscious. The first day we were there, the outdoor pool seemed too hot, but the next morning, it was perfect. We don't know how much control they have over the temperature of the pools, but it's heaven when it's hot outside and the water is cool. The waters let you feel as if your troubles are floating away. I can't say enough about how relaxing it is. The staff are very friendly and accomodating, supplying us with towels whenever we went up to the front desk and asked for them. I definitely recommend going to the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort.

Reviews.Title: “out of order room”
Reviews.Author: 1unhappylady
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving after our 3 hour 85 degree road trip I was welcomed with," oh we've been waiting for you. Unfortunately your confirmed room is "out of order" no other rooms are available". I asked "why didn't you call and advise me of this so I didn't waste a trip up here with gas prices being the way they are". Their reply: we tried. Of course I never received such a call. I was then told that we'd been booked into a hotel a half mile away, with no pool.( the main purpose was the mineral pools) I was told that we were more than welcome to drive and use Roman Spa's pools, of course. There were no other vacant hotels with mineral pools. We ended up leaving and returning home another 3 hours away

Reviews.Title: “The Spa AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH”
Reviews.Author: jeddy007
Reviews.Content: Have always stayed at the Roman Spa, and have always been pleased with the courtesy of the employees & how clean & tidy the rooms & grounds are. It is also close to downtown & you can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: danygrl10
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a weekend get away, it's a block from the main drag in Calistoga. It has small outdated kitchens but the hotsprings, bbq area and great service make up for that! A great place for the connivence and price.

Reviews.Title: “Always return for rest and clean accomodations”
Reviews.Author: misscat1
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa is the best property in Calistoga. The rooms are always clean. The gardens are very well kept. The pools are very relaxing. The entire staff is very friendly. It is not a fancy hotel, just comfortable. We have been going there for 20 years. We have tried other properties, but always go back to Roman Spa, becasue they are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne4
Reviews.Content: My kids and I go to the Roman Spa at least once a year. It's relaxing for me and a treat for the kids. Calistoga in general is an adult destination for honeymoon couples and wedding parties, and wine tasters. At the Roman Spa, we've found a place where kids are welcome too. We usually get a kitchenette and hang around the warm mineral pools for most of our visit. The rooms are clean and there are always hundreds of flowers blooming on the grounds of the hotel. It's a nice retreat for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Again!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchyTahoeCity_CA
Reviews.Content: April 11, 2008 Sue Duvall Rossi We should be in Kauai right now. Yes, we are part of history, Airline history. April 7th to 14th in a free condo and ATA Airlines went under. So, we thought of Calistoga and the Roman Spa. The Roman Spa is the only place we ever stay, coming almost every year when we can. We love the proximity to Main St. and all the restuarants and shopping. We absoutly love the lush and beautiful gardens the pools and piece and Quite. Highly Suggest you come and Enjoy, Sue Duvall Rossi

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tulips”
Reviews.Author: mariaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a couple of restful days at the Roman Spa in Calistoga. The gardens filled with pots of tulips enhanced the clean and comfortable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly waters and central location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSoaker
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation the old fashioned way, by phone, and received great service from the start. Once we arrived, it was hard to get out of the Roman Spa's three pools - an outdoor swimming pool, an indoor swimming pool with gentle jets, and an outdoor jacuzzi with high powered jets - but being only a block or two from excellent restaurants and super shopping gave us plenty to do when we dried off. The Roman Spa has massages and mud baths on the premises, too, which adds soothing options for relaxation. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place in Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: billtrish
Reviews.Content: We hadn't stayed at the Roman Spa For some time but thought it was time to give them another try. In the last few years we have stayed at Dr. W's, the Calistoga Spa, and Solage. Our room was clean and comfortable and the bed actually firm [!]...features that are to be expected. But the pools were at perfect temperatures, one warm, one intermediate and one HOT. Again features that are expected in Calistoga... What sets the Roman Spas apart though is the service that the staff provides and the grounds. Every employee that we encountered was working hard to provide an environment that is relaxing. The grounds are simply amazing! Pots of tulips and daffodils in full bloom; other plantings well cared for; pathways clean and swept. Many small things but the sum is a great place to stay in Calistoga. AAA gives it 3 stars; I give it 4! Will we stay there again?? You can bet on It!!

Reviews.Title: “soak away your cares”
Reviews.Author: anicat-8
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose the Roman Spa Hot Springs for a 3 day getaway because of sentimental memories of our late mother vacationing there once or twice a year. The hotel is clean, well-organized, with beautiful grounds and with kitchen units available, we were able to stay on a reasonble travel budget.The staff were unfailingly courteous and provided helpful input on where to eat in the town,including some discount vouchers for some popular restaurants. But as always, the real highlight is "taking the waters". With 3 different pools/spas,the waters work their magic of unknotting tense muscles and softening the edges of life. My skin, usually so dry, becomes magically soft and silky after just one soaking there. Conveniently located, across a small parking area, is the associated Oasis spa, where we enjoyed mud baths,herbal soaks and massages. I felt like I had been away for a week, not just 3 days! The town is fun to explore, with a great little museum, fun quality shops and many fine restaurants. I hear that there is also great hiking around there, but we did not take advantage of that. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: pearl77
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort is one of our favorites. We usually travel to Calistoga once to twice a year and we have stayed at a few places but this remains our favorite. One thing I love is that they have a variety of pools at different temperatures so you can always find one that is right for you. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with a year round abundance of bright flowers, and the atmosphere is quiet and relaxing. The Resort is centrally located in Calistoga and only half a block from one of the best restaurants in Calistoga. Of all the places I have stayed The Roman has the largest rooms for the price. Although it is not a sheshe resort The Roman is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mdcbSonoma
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa, once again was great. The Staff upon check-in and Check-out were very helpful. The three pools defintely give the vistor a chance to experience relaxation but also an oportunity to meet great and friendly people from all over the world. The Roman Spa also is very kid friendly. If you are looking for a weekend get-away or a week long vacation....The Roman Spa is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: matto1124
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. Paid nearly $200 for room with expectancy for nice relaxing time. After getting our room and settling down we noticed we could clearly hear the people in both the rooms next to us. Decided to ask for another room and they offered an upgraded room for no extra cost w/ nobody staying on either side. Sounded great except for the people in the room above us. To make a long story short we only slept about 3 hours because the place was so noisy. We checked out the next morning but we were suppose to stay another night. No refund for my first night stay. If you are expecting a quite place this is not the place for you. If noise doesn't bother you then it is ok. The hot springs were great.

Reviews.Title: “Cheezy Name”
Reviews.Author: bgoz
Reviews.Content: The name is cheezy but everything else about the place is classy. (There are no nubile, toga clad, laurel wreathed youths strumming lutes and lolling about the pool area) The location is perfect: across the street from an interesting museum and a block or two away from at least a dozen good restaurants. If you want to avoid the restaurant expense, many units have sparkling clean, well equipped kitchenettes, (there were three corkscrews, the most critical of all kitchen implements, in the utensil drawer in our room). The three pools with varying temperatures were clean and meticulously cared for. There is a spa facility for massages, facials and mudbaths fifty feet from the rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful and generous with towels.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: mizruby
Reviews.Content: Just back from a Valentine getaway weekend to Calistoga. This place is wonderful! The outdoor tubs are marvelous, the hotel and grounds are very very clean, the landscaped garden is manicured and lovely. A coffee cart on the poolside patio and fresh warm towels for early bird bathers, heaven!! Whomever made the comment along the lines of "a few hanging baskets does not a garden make" needs another visit, this is truly an oasis. Its location makes it perfect, only a block away from Lincoln Ave where the action is, shops, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “warm/hot pools for swimming and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: dengellenner
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms very clean and well decorated. Staff friendly, but best of all were the 3 pools to choose from for natural occurring heated temperatures for soaking or swim or looking at the stars in the outside pool. Yes, even in Jan it is still wonderful to swim in the very warm outside pool. This is all part of the package with the hotel surrounding the pools and the provided breakfast is outstanding at the local cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: ginnsac
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan 28th-29th '08. The Roman Spa was beautifully landscaped and the rooms very clean. The employees greeted us with smiles and "Hellos." The Hot Mineral Springs were our favorite part...they were so relaxing and we could choose between the 3 different pools at 3 different temperatures, which was awesome. We also booked a Mudbath/ massage package at the Spa. And there's so much to do in the area; we drove to see the Old Faithful Geyser and Petrified Forest and a winery along the way. We thoroughly enjoyed our getaway, the only problem we found was that it wasn't long enough. We will be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa is a great get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: choc0
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa is funky and comfortable; the spa and pool are warm and inviting. Love the fact that the Oasis is right across the parking lot. A great place to veg with your girlfriends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Restfull”
Reviews.Author: kitpic
Reviews.Content: All the emoloyees were so friendly and the grounds were beautiful with all the lovely flowers. The large warm pool was very relaxing and felt SO good, so I had a full nights sleep after the warm swim.

Reviews.Title: “After You're Done Wine Tasting...”
Reviews.Author: lemb
Reviews.Content: Recently my friend & I took a rather spontaneous trip to the Napa Valley wine country without making advanced plans for accomodations. By the end of our wine tasting day, we were delighted to receive a recommendation from a friendly wine pourer at the Rosenblum tasting room in Healdsburg, CA. She told us about the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort in Calistoga where she & some girlfriends had gone several times when in the area. When we arrived in the early evening we were greeted by their attentive staff and were quite pleased by the reasonable pricing of their rooms. The room was clean and tasteful but not overly pretentious. But the best part were the three roomy spa/pools of varying degrees of heat to relax in at the end of our day. Two of which are outside amongst the gardens and the third was inside just off the patio, so you can easily go from one to the next depending on your heat preferences. The evening air was cool and it was truely relaxing. We will definitely go there again, and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay and great escapade…”
Reviews.Author: 2composers
Reviews.Content: We visited for the first time beginning of November to celebrate a birthday. Had a very pleasant booking experience over the phone, both professional and courteous. Their computer system is new and has just been installed. Arrived early on Sunday and were able get into our room before the official move-in time. Our room overlooked the swimming pool, it was very clean and all we expected. Maid service is great, it is run by a woman from Germany named Elfriede, who also brought us our breakfast coupons for the Café Sarafornia. We spent hours in the three pools, pleasant and clean, to soak our tired bones. I only used the Internet once in three days, they have a PC installed for free access in the registration office. We loved the flowers, the quietness of the place, the quality of the waters, and the fact that everything in Calistoga is a hop, skip and a jump away from the hotel. Met very nice fellow travelers from the Bay Area, and regulars who insisted this was the best place to stay for hot mineral baths in Calistoga. Quiet, nice gardens, spotlessly clean, nice staff, and proximity of all stores and restaurants make this our place of choice when coming to the North of Napa Valley. We received a bottle of Chandon Sparkling Wine to celebrate the birthday, a much appreciated gesture; we ended up extending another day because we liked it a lot, and enjoyed our escapade and mini-vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: winidytoo
Reviews.Content: I have been returning to the Roman Spa when I am looking for time away in peaceful and tranquil space. he accomodations are very comfortable with kitchenettes and barbecue grills. The gardens are lovely with wide varieties of flowering plants and shrubs, koi ponds and hummingbird feeders. There is a larger mineral pool, 2 hot tubs with varied temperature and sauna facilities. And when you are ready for more pampering, there is the "Oasis Spa" to meet your needs for a massage, mudbath or facial.The Roman Spa is itself an oasis of tranquility and relaxation. It's a great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the $$”
Reviews.Author: eg5
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is good quality for the money. It is a basic motel with a spa on the premise. The grounds are well landscaped with a heated pool and indoor jacuzzi. The people were very friendly. The room was clean and updated and the location is one block from all the restaurants and shops. The night we were there was cold and rainy so not too many people outside. What i did notice is there are lots of chairs and tables outside of the rooms with ash trays on them. Would not be too appealing if people were outside your room smoking.

Reviews.Title: “hated this dingy dump with attitude”
Reviews.Author: estebe99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this roman "spa resort" recently and agree with the many people here who complained about the quality, price and service. Don't trust the many recent "glowing" reports. This place is more of a dingy old motel than any kind of resort. The rooms are small and very dated and the staff all seemed to have an attitude. I would never stay here again. There is many better places to stay in Calistoga at cheaper prices. Definitely shop around and whatever you do, do NOT give them your credit card number before you see the property and your room!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: DSGould
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa was a special treat. The facilities are clean and the grounds are meticulously upkept. The pools are refreshing and relaxing - we have stayed at the Roman Spa in the past and plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools!”
Reviews.Author: caligal82
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful weekend in Calistoga. We've stayed at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort twice now, and the experience has been great for us. We found the hotel rates very reasonable. The hotel is not fancy but everything was clean and tidy in the room. What brings us back to stay there is the three pools. My husband has a bad back, so it can be hard for him to do many activities when we go on vacation. However, being in the water helps his back to feel better and we consider it to be a fun activity to do together. There are three pools (one at 96 degrees, one at 100 degrees, and a hot tub at 104 degrees). We would go swimming about three times a day. The great thing is that often you cannot stay in a pool for too long without getting cold or too hot (in a hot tub), but because of the perfect temperature of the outdoor pool we could stay in it for hours, having fun and it is great for my husband's back! The grounds are very beautiful with all of the flowers, and we like that the resort is such a short walk from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “25 years and counting”
Reviews.Author: 14the road
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Roman Spa and in the past 25 years little has changed. The Spa is extremely relaxing, clean, quiet and my favorite spot in the hamlet of Calistoga-mind you, it is neither fancy or luxurious, but it is homey and a welcome change from life's hustle bustle-not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: laffamy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from another fabulous stay at the Roman Spa. Each year I yearn for this spot as a birthday destination because it is the most pleasant stay in this area! I can leave the car in the parking lot until we leave town. We feel safe, the rooms are clean, the staff is super friendly and accomodating and the prices are usually manageable. The different pools help to soak all the tension out of my muscles. The nearby restaurants and bookstores and shopping options are fun. The wine country and St. Helena's Culinary Institute are very close. The aesthetics of the spa's courtyards and all the options (rooms with kitchenettes or simply refrigerators and the like) all entice me to return year after year. The air is even clearer up there!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa was Nice”
Reviews.Author: geb1222
Reviews.Content: Roman spa is in Calistoga, a quaint town at the top of Napa Valley. Initially I was a little concerned after hearing that the owners of the hotel were offering raffle prizes for tripadvisor reviews. Personally I think that skews the true value of rating hotels. However, we enjoyed are stay very much. The rooms are somewhat older, but very clean, comfy and had all the amenities that we needed (nice mini fridge!). The pools are heated by thermal springs in the area and I must say are very nice. The location of the motel is perfect, just of the side street from the main drag which has many good restaurants (Calistoga Inn was real good). The hotel seems to be frequented by older travelers who may be repeat visitors. The motel offers some things that attract them like large fridges and outside grills. My only negatives were that there seemed to be a lot of people around (staff or whatever), and that the value was just average. Overall the motel was nice and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: spaqueenSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The Roman spa in Calistoga, is a paradise of flowers, humming birds, fountains, and mineral pools. We return here year after year anticipating the relaxed and rejuvinated sensations that overcome us during our visits. The pools have varing degrees of temperatures, you can find your bliss in anyone or all of them. The service is superb, with easy acess to extra towels, and friendly desk service. The location is perfect, just steps away from main street, and its great eateries. The tranquil atmospher is really pleasing with the beatiful grounds, flowers, fountains, and Palm trees, I think the hummingbirds are slow to migrate because they refuse to leave this oasis. We love the Roman Spa and plan our return when ever we can.

Reviews.Title: “Been Staying There Since 1979!”
Reviews.Author: sacchief
Reviews.Content: Been Staying There Since 1979! We have enjoyed this facility since 1979. Originally somewhat rustic, the facility has been greatly upgraded. It is very conveniently located just one block from all of the community's attractions. The hotel itself offers a full service spa, plus 3 great pools, with temperatures of 95 degrees, 98 degrees, and 104 degrees.One reason we have repeatedly chosen this facility is its cleanliness and very attractive gardens. It is centrally located in the midst of Northern California's wine country, and is only about 100 miles from either the San Francisco Bay Area or Sacramento.

Reviews.Title: “Romans is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SouthBayAreaSoaker
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have been going to Roman's for a few years now and our time spent there just gets better and better. The 3 pools are perfect soaking temperatures, the staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and the location is extremely convenient. We will continue to return year after year and only hope to be able to go more often.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: anchik35
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day at the Roman Spa Hot Springs. The resort is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. Warm mineral pool and jacuzzis were great. We did not get out of the water for all 4 days. The Spa is out of this world. We paid $249 per night for a room l which we thought excellent value. There were 2 queen beds so the 3 of us shared, full kitchen, fridge, microvawe, toaster, dishes and everything you need. We baebwqued at the gas and charcoal grills available outside and used picnic tables. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenfromcali
Reviews.Content: I honestly have to say this is the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in!! We booked this hotel based on the great reviews and the draw of a "Family" suite. We got there only to find that their "Family" suite has a wallbed and one bedroom, not to mention their so called "Full sized kitchen" was smaller than me kitchen table! The room was $300 a night...WAY more than much nicer hotels in Calistoga. Not to mention, we had spiders in every corner of the room, the hotel staff was EXTREMELY rude, and called me a liar. We booked the hotel for 4 adults and 2 kids and they told me that they were doing ME a favor letting us stay there. I must say I will NEVER EVER stay here again!!! If you are going to Calistoga or Napa, stay at Carlin Country Cottages...they are MUCH cheaper and are VERY nice to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Super Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: ka7890
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa Motel and Spa was a very nice experience for my wife and I. We stayed for three nights over the Labor Day holiday. Although it was a little expensive at approximately $200 per night and a three night minimum stay during the holiday weekend, we enjoyed the stay very much. The motel feels very much like you’ve entered a time machine back to the 1970s, to a much more simpler way of life. The rooms are definitely nothing fancy but they are clean with hot water, air conditioning, cable television, and even a small refrigerator in the room. The only negative about the room was the sound of water flowing through the pipes whenever someone in an adjacent room turned on the spigot or flushed the toilet. We had a second floor room overlooking the pools and the very well kept landscaping. There are three pools at three different temperatures depending upon what you’re looking for. It seemed that there were many eastern Europeans guests during our stay. Perhaps they understand and appreciate more the benefits of the mineral spa. The pool closes at 10:00 pm so there was never a problem with too much noise. We were in the pool each morning and then after a hard day of wine country tourism, again in the evening. Outside our room, there were many tables and chairs and even a grilling area. Many people were cooking their own dinner and enjoying their Napa Valley selections of wine. The motel was full of very laid back and friendly people. It was a bit like being in a campground, meeting many different people. Perhaps because of the three night minimum stay requirement, after the first day, we recognized most of our neighbors and were on friendly terms. We took mud baths at the Oasis Spa which is right next door to the motel. The volcanic ash and peat moss mixed with hot water has a distinctive smell that some may not take a liking too but for us, it was no problem. Our attendant was there whenever we needed her without being intrusive. It was an interesting experience that is worth trying. The facilities are simple much like the motel. There’s nothing fancy or pretentious here. The main street of Calistoga, Lincoln Avenue, is just a short block from the hotel. There are several restaurants on the street. Two we visited are Miguel’s, a Mexican restaurant. The salsa Miguel makes is extremely good. You can pick up a coupon for $5 off any order of more than $10 at the visitor’s center across from the Cal-Mart grocery store. We ate breakfast and dinner there and was greeted each time by Miguel himself. The other restaurant we recommend is Checkers directly across from Miguel’s. It was recommended to us by the lady selling pecan brittle at the Saturday morning Farmer’s Market. The pecan brittle ($5 for a bag) was very good too. For a good cup of coffee, try the Calistoga Roasters next to Checkers.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: TheBixster
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place in a perfect location. Easy access to walking around town. Clean rooms. Pleasant and accomodating staff. Beautifully landscaped. Relaxing, warm pools. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxation”
Reviews.Author: rosekoco
Reviews.Content: My friends and I turned 50 this year and decided we needed some pampering. We enjoyed a spa weekend with a little bit of wine tasting thrown in for good measure. Couldn't have been better, unless it had been longer!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: tg94901
Reviews.Content: Rm 125 is the best in the house! We loved our little veranda overlooking the pool. Quaint and low key, and right off the main street of Calistoga. A perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite getaway”
Reviews.Author: 4sioux
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Roman Spa for years with friends for the warm water pools. Have tried a few of the other spas in town but this one is the best (though not the cheapest..). The place is always spotless and well-maintained. The warm pools are great, with both an indoor and outdoor pool. We usually get a room with attached kitchen since we always seem to bring back left-overs from our various meals out -- lots of great restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelerfromCA99
Reviews.Content: Be very clear, this is NOT a resort and this is NOT a spa. This property is nothing more than an old outdated motel. Do not be fooled by the glowing reviews on this website. I can't understand how anyone would give this place a good review except for the fact that the management offers a raffle for a free stay if you write a review... I went to this property for a well deserved weekend away. For $216 a night for a room with a King sized bed I expected a real resort with a nice spa. That is not at all what I found. First, the seating area outside the room was nothing more than a cement walkway with chairs which the cleaners used as their personal place to keep their cleaning supplies. I had to request that they move their extra towels and windex to another place. The buildings are old apartment style stucco buildings. The rooms are outdated and drab. The bed was rock hard with stiff pillows and old bedspread and I was affraid to look at the sheets let alone sleep in them. The tv volume did not work and I spent the first hour of my stay with the maintenance man trying to fix it. He ended up fixing the volume but making it so there was no picture. They said there was nothing else they could do. There was no internet access and if you wanted to watch a movie you had to bring your own. Who brings their own DVD's or VHS tapes on vacation? I was not told this beforehand anyway. The towels were rough and thin and looked as if they had been bleached a million times. In the 70's style orange and brown linoleum bathroom there were 2 mismatched mini soaps and a mini bottle of Neutorgena shampoo placed on the sink- that was it for the ammenities. I spent more to get a room with a whirlpool. The tub was large and shallow. They warned me about the sulpher smell of the hot spring water but nothing could have prepared me for the smell of rotten eggs that filled the room. The only way to get rid of the smell was to open the tiny window in the bathroom which looked out to the parking lot- it did not help at all. Right outside my room were old coin opperated washers and dryers right out in the open. It looked like a bad apartment complex. The "grounds" tried to be nice but the plants could use some watering and the pools were made of old cement and crowded. The "spa" if you can call it that was a trailor looking establishment in the parking lot. I have to say I didn't even go in. Long story short, I checked in and checked out within an hour and a half. I chose to give up my weekend by myself and go home instead. That should tell you something. Don't be fooled by the other reviews. If you are looking for a pampering weekend do not stay here. If you are looking for a mediocre depressing motel - you will absolutley love it.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite stop on our California vacation”
Reviews.Author: cathydonald
Reviews.Content: I booked the Roman Spa on the basis of reviews on this site (which I use often, and has never let me down). However I then noticed a number of less positive reviews and comments, so I had some concerns. I wanted to write this review to reassure anyone else who plans on visiting. Firstly, let me say that we are a family of 5, travelling from Scotland. During our month-long trip we stayed in a variety of accommodation, from Big Sur Lodge (basic but great location) to Seascape in Aptos (good facilities, but a bit soulless) to Stanford Inn in Mendocino (very nice, but a bit stiff). We enjoyed each and every one, but my personal favourite was the Roman Spa. As already stated on this website, the Roman Spa is definitely motel-style accommodation, but it makes no pretences to the contrary. We had a family room for 5 which was great - a double bed and a separate room with 3 singles. It also had a small kitchen area. We all loved the pools, and especially the fact that they were open until 10. We lay in the pools after dinner one evening, gazing at the stars and surrounded by palm trees. We did not use the BBQ facilities as we were only there for 2 nights, but definitely would have if we had stayed longer. We only discovered the complimentary cart of tea and coffee on our last morning. My husband and I both had mud baths and massages. I agree that the spa accommodation is basic and could do with updating, but I cannot fault the service, and felt fantastic afterwards. My ongoing hip pain completely disappeared for a few days. All in all, a really relaxing place to stay. The pool are great, and the many shaded areas surrounding the pools make it a great option for families with children. Finally, it was great to stay somewhere which allowed us to walk to local restaurants, so my husband could have a glass of wine with dinner too! By the way, we highly recommend Sarafonia for a great breakfast in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY if you have kids and you like your wallet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DHJr
Reviews.Content: Paid 300.00 a night for a tired "family suite", only to find it was a one bedroom room with a wallbed in the main living room. Kitchen is small, and the room is older in look and furnishings. Pool and spas are stained but ok, but get this - we took our two year old into the pool area only to be reprimanded and told that it was a "law" that we couldn't have him in the pool. Funny - we've stayed in other hotels in Calistoga and NEVER had that problem. I believe it was most likely an insurance issue. Stay away...We enjoy our stays in another very nice Calistoga property as we go up there frequently, and the only reason we took a chance on this place was that it was booked. In the future, we'll make sure it's available..!!! (If I could give ZERO stars as a review, I would)

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feklar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roman Spa on a weekday. The staff was pleasant, kind, and efficient. The room was clean and tastefully decorated. Outdoor area was beautifully landscaped on hotel grounds. Pluses: the outdoor pool, outdoor jacuzzi, and indoor large spa pool and dry sauna that come with room rental, refridgerator in room, comfortable bed, one block from downtown Calistoga. Minuses: no discount package with their partnering Oasis Spa adjacent to the hotel, and room was overpriced for the size and for a weekday. Also, the Oasis Spa is basically part of the parking lot; it has no vegetation and the building looks drab and uninviting for having a massage or other spa treatment-a stark contrast to the Roman Spa Hotel itself. Overall, we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: AnitaRose
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Roman Spa for 23 years. It is nestled at the upper end of the Napa Valley in the quaint town of Calistoga, California. NO FAST FOOD. You are surrounded on 3 sides by the beautiful mountains and the valley opens up to the magnificant grape vineyards of the Napa Valley. The 3 pools are fed through the natural hot springs that flow underneath the hotel. The water is cooled before going into the pools which range in temp of 95 to 105. Enjoy the warm, therapeutic water from 8:00am to 10:00 pm, watch the hummingbirds feeding and enjoy the natural beauty of the gardens in the surrounding area. Of course there are many different restaurants and wineries to suit your palate and pocket book. We found this wonderful getaway by accident and have been goind back ever since.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Hiker777
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Roman Spa. The room was comfortable and clean. The 3 pools were between 90 and 100 degrees. The property is only 1 block away from the main street in town so it was very convenient. It is only a 15 minute drive to Robert Louis Stevenson park from where you can hike to the top of Mt. St. Helena. We used a spa at a different property because the pricing was more competitive. I would stay at the Roman Spa again.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Chatajohn
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa in Calistoga has some surprises and some modest disappointments. Over all it gets a thumbs up from our family. The pools are it's attraction - 1 for swimming and 1 regular sized jacuzzi just off of that. But, inside no less is a larger jacuzzi type pool w/ locker rooms and such. The pools and the in room jacuzzi's, if you book that type of room, have "hot" mineral water, beautiful landscaping and a fish pond hidden nearby the big pool. The room was large, modestly appointed and clean. The in room jacuzzi would fit you and 3 of your closest friends if you so desired. WARNING: the mineral water is HOT. Be careful in your room jacuzzi! It is near main street and several other spas and several very good restaurants - see restaurant comments separately! The Wine Garage is nearby for bargain hunters of good vino and it is located in the heart of what will become the newest regional wine appellation. For all of that it was a bit pricey and although you have a small refrigerator in your room, you don't get your own coffee pot. Has cable, but no premium channels. The layout is more like a Best Western, than a fine hotel, can be noisy. Have fun. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best way to Relax and Unwind”
Reviews.Author: RomanSpaGirl
Reviews.Content: We have returned time and again to enjoy this beautiful spot in Calistoga. The spa's have a healing effect and are warm and so comforting. The grounds are beautiful and the atmosphere is perfect. It is a quiet place and a perfect place to get away!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend of Luxury - Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: jengaCA
Reviews.Content: Just what the doctor ordered.....a weekend at the Roman Spa. The hotel was packed - booked with various people, but it felt like our own little romantic get-a-way. We arrived early on Friday - 1:30pm and we were able to check in since our room was ready! We were assigned a room - right about the pool on the top floor. At first we were sceptical, afraid we would hear everything going on in the resort. It was a fantastic spot. Centrally located to exiting the property, pool and the Oasis spa next door. The shared balcony worked out great as we could enjoy our relaxing time throughout the day when not enjoying the fantastic mineral water pool! Everything was clean, and comfortable, and the kitchen had everything we needed. The staff was accomodating and friendly and always willing to help make our stay fabulous. It was a weekend to remember. We went to the Roman Spa every year about 10 years ago - we decided to go back and enjoy - we are so glad we did and we are already looking forward to our next visit to the Roman Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected.”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly6
Reviews.Content: This was a unique experience. I have been to more than 80 countries, and I have stayed in better places in third world countries. It took the receptionist 25 minutes to find the reservation. We waited. Once we did get to the room, the first impression was a musty odor that met us at the door. The bed was incredibly stiff. Carpets were worn. The air conditioner made such a racket we couldn't sleep. The pools smelled of chlorine and were unexceptional. This in no way felt like a retreat or resort, like they advertise. It's an old Motel trying to pass for a resort. We were very dissatisfied with the Roman Spa Motel. We recommend that readers dig further into the reviews here, like we wish we would have done before spending so much for so little. It turns out there have been many unhappy guests here.

Reviews.Title: “the best in calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: mrschocokitty
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriends and I go to The Roman Spa Resort twice yealy and have never been dissapointed. The rooms are always neat and clean, and reception is friendly and available to help with anything. The three hot pools are never too hot or too cold, and the gardens are absolutly beautiful with humming birds flying about the many nector feeders. The property is quiet and most condusive to relaxation, it is also very close to the mian shopping area. We will never go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis spa”
Reviews.Author: gabenyc
Reviews.Content: Can't speak to the hotel, but got a mud bath and massage at the oasis spa that's attached to the hotel. The treatment was fine -- pretty much the standard calistoga mud and mineral bath. The spa itself is in a little trailer that they've fixed up right next to the hotel. It's nice enough, but don't expect anything super fabulous. Only real drawback is that the facilities are kind of small, so you can hear people moving around and talking while you're trying to relax during the massage. I'm not sure there's anyplace better in calistoga -- my sense is that these places pretty much do the same sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Roman Spa!”
Reviews.Author: CAMacaroni
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our recent stay at the Roman Spa hotel in Calistoga, California. We are very happy to submit a glowing review for this unparalleled relaxation and rejuvenation spot. We have stayed at several other places in Calistoga in the past, as we love the area - but after our first visit to Roman Spa many years ago, we never go anywhere else due to its excellent value, its lush garden-like landscaping and the three superb mineral water pools. Each pool is delightfully warm, one slightly warmer than the next. The geothermal mineral water in the pools is truly a special pleasure to soak in, and it leaves skin very soft, among other benefits. We take advantage of the 2-night internet specials for midweek nights only. This provides the best rate for the best hotel in the area. There are more expensive and perhaps more luxurious rooms at other hotels, but for overall relaxation and rejuvenation at pricing that is conducive to said relaxation, Roman Spa is by far the best value. The rooms are clean and simple, and tastefuly decorated. The hotel offers free coffee, and other seasonal specials if you check the internet. For those who enjoy wine-tasting, Calistoga is at the 'high end' of the Napa valley, and has numerous specialty wineries within minutes from the hotel. Additionally, the nearby Palisades range offers spectacular vistas for the excercise-minded vacationer who enjoys hiking or biking. Right next door is the Oasis mud bath and massage spa, only a few feet from the hotel. Combine a package at Oasis with a stay at Roman Spa for one of the most comprehensive relaxation treatments available anywhere. We can't wait till we can return again, and enjoy poolside coffee while soaking in the therapeutic waters!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GETAWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: effieSanFranicscoCa
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is one the the Gems of the Wine Country. You can go for a romantic weekend getaway,Weekend with the Girls, or just a quick getaway from all the crazilness of the City. The property has great rooms with refrigerators, hair driers and kitchens. The staff is very helpful and always there to accomidate to your needs. You have 3 mineral pools to choose from. The setting is very Mediterranian with lights trinkling when the sun sets and into the night. There are picnic table and barbarque grills if you would like to eat on the property. With fresh coffee or tea in the morning served in the lobby. Whenever my family or friends want to getaway for a weekend of relaxed fun we always go to the Roman Spa. Oh did I mention that the Oasis Spa is right next door for you pampering needs- Mud Baths, Massages and Ect. We just cannot wait to visit the Roman Spa again. Effie Arnolfo

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 2getawat
Reviews.Content: My huband and I just recently returned from a peaceful and relaxing extended weekend at the Roman Spa Hot Springs in Calistoga. We return to this heavenly resort every year in February or March to have a weekend to rest and enjoy the beautiful surrounding of the Roman Spa. Not only is the heated pool and indoor Jacuzzi used, but the peaceful and beautiful grounds at the Roman Spa are something we look forward to visiting. The flowers are beautiful. We have some friends who join us on this wonderful weekend and on the grounds they have available picnic tables, along with BBQ's to use. This year they have added a gas BBQ and it was great! We met our friends, who were also staying at the Roman Spa, for dinner out at the picnic tables and really enjoyed ourselves. We also love the friendly visitors and staff at the Roman Spa and we have made this a tradition for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: irvinm
Reviews.Content: For well over 15 years...my wife and I always stay at the Roman Spa when visiting the wonderful town of Calistoga. A full service spa, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and only a one block walk to the main street to fest on delicious food! Better yet, In addition to a large outdoor pool and hot tub, they also have a perfectly heated indoor pool that we absolutely love! Do yourself a favor and stay at Roman Spa. Irvin M. CA

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: travelnab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Roman Spa Resort and after reading all the glowing reviews, we were a little surprised when we arrived. In our minds we were expecting a resort, however, after entering the grounds it was more like a motel. It reminded me a of Best Western or Motel 6. The buildings were dated and the outdoor pool and hottub looked like those you would find at one of the previously mentioned hotels (small bean shaped pool with a black iron fence around it and green astro turf). The rooms were also dated as was the bathroom, but I was advised of the bathroom when I booked the room. We reserved the room with the jacuzzi, and it was quite large. The only thing is since it is so large, it does take a while to fill it -- about 20-30 mins. Since the mineral water comes out quite hot, the resort advises you should wait another 30 mins before getting in. We waited 35 minutes, and it was still very hot. I would recommend waiting 50-60 mins for a decent temperature. So all in all you have to wait about 1 - 1.5 hours to use the tub. You can use cold water to use it sooner (which is what we did), however, it dilutes the mineral water and ends up being more like a normal bath with jets in it, and you're not getting the full premium of the mineral water. Lastly, because the water is so hot, it ends up being like a steam room in your bathroom (which some of you might not mind). You are asked to keep the bathroom door closed when using the jets, and since our bathroom overlooked the parking lot we didn't feel comfortable keeping the window open. So it got very hot in there very quickly (not only sitting in the steam but also very hot water as well), so we could not use it for very long ~ 10 minutes. So about 1 - 1.5 hours of prep for about 10 minutes worth of use. On the flip side, we really enjoyed the indoor spa, and it was a perfect temperature -- we were not too hot or cold so we could stay in there for an extended period of time and just relax. The pools were not too crowded, and the resort is the perfect walking distance to downtown Calistoga. All in all our stay was okay. Your experience will really depend on your expectations prior to your visit. At $200+ per night, we went expecting a little more from our room and a lot more from the resort (bigger pools, nicer grounds, etc.). At this price point, we would likely look for nicer accomodations and skip the jacuzzi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Trackster880
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have never had a bad stay at Roman Spa. It is one of the best values in the Calistoga. The staff is accomodating, prompt and friendly. The rooms and grounds are always clean and neat. It is convenient and centrally located to all activities and Restaurants in Calistoga. We are back there at least once a year. Sal & Barbara Crispi - Concord, CA

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: smilesf
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa The Roman Spa is an oasis in the heart of downtown Calistoga. It is located conveniently near the downtown area and across the street from the pioneer museum. My first visit was when I came on a holiday weekend and stayed for a long July 4th overnight and weekend visit. As a tourist on an all American holiday, I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of privacy the Roman Spa offers on even the busiest weekend of the year. How can they do this? Gardens, in a word. Gardens, lighting, and lots of patio furniture strategically placed, gives the Roman Spa an edge. Reading a book under the grape arbor, I was approached by the staff and offered a pillow for even more comfort. People can spread out and relax on the many beautiful groupings of furniture surrounding the pool, and two courtyards. The gardens enclose the Roman Spa and after years of care and attention, the palm trees, the vines, and the many flowering annuals glow with warmth that soothes the soul. As a get away, Calistoga is easy and convenient to all the wine country tours and the gourmet restaurants in the area. A short drive from San Francisco lands you in Calistoga and a half block from the main drag lands you in the Roman Spa. An asset to my stay at the Roman Spa was the fact that I book a room with a kitchen. The local Cal Mart is a short walk away and my family always goes to the store for snacks, breakfast, and lunch foods. Since we love going out to fine restaurants in the area, the kitchen offers us a chance to eat our lunch and breakfast in, while we launch out on the evening dining from our room. Since the rooms all front the beautiful courtyard and gardens, we can eat breakfast on the patio in style with our outdoor dining. On my first stay, July 4th, many fellow spa customers were grilling in the grill area and I noticed family picnics going on. None of these were obtrusive for the other guests, again due to the lovely arrangement of grouped furniture and garden surroundings. After I get to the Roman Spa, the trick is to unwind from my busy life. How do I do this? In a few words, unplug. Ok, there is a TV in each room, but mine stays off. I don’t bring a computer with me, although my daughter brought hers and went to the local Internet café one block away from the Roman Spa. For me, unplugging is the answer to why the Roman Spa is my haven and home away from home. My cell phone is handy, but somehow is rendered less important in the setting. My favorite TV shows can wait. Yes, the Roman Spa is an oasis of calm in my busy life. I started staying on long weekends and after that first July 4th went for Labor Day and Memorial Day weekends. These busy weekends found me enjoying the pools, which include the hot tub, the swimming pool, and the indoor hot soaking pool. I swim and do laps in the morning and the pool is never overly crowded despite the busy holiday weekends. My new approach to the Roman Spa is to go more than twice a year, where I now go mid week and stay through the weekend. The pool is even more exciting when less people are in it, which is every morning at 8:00 when they open and I’m the first one in. Our new technique is to go to the Roman Spa on a Wed. or Thur. and spend a while unwinding. One other thing I love about the Roman Spa is the visual stimulation of the place where you are surrounded in a bowl of beautiful mountains in the wine country. The Spa is beyond beautiful as already stated, but the close proximity to the surrounding region makes the oasis within the Roman Spa more like a jewel in a crown of beauty. Ok, the shallow part of me also loves to shop in the vintage clothing stores, buy fudge in the candy shop, and spend time picking up candles for my table at the candle store. For an ultimate relaxing weekend in a beautiful setting, pick the Roman Spa. It is the place to be for all ages. Families, couples, or even single people looking for a break and a place to think will all enjoy the Roman Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Roman Spa Every time!!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is in the heart of Calistoga, and easy to walk anywhere in town from it's convenient location. The pool is warm year round and they have a very large indoor hot tub that's mineral water soothes your skin and relaxes you beyond belief. The rooms are clean and spacious. Our room had a kitchenette included. There are BBQ's and picnic tables around the beautiful landscaped grounds if you decide you would like to eat in. The Roman spa is our one and only choice of lodging whenever we visit Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Best outdoor pools in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: TerryRussianHill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed there many times and love the outdoor pools and grounds. The bath house could use an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hot Pools”
Reviews.Author: bigskinney
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 2 days at the Roman Spa in during the first week of March, 2007. The room was very clean and very comfortable. The grounds were gorgeous, and I especially like that coffee was served on a tea cart just outside the office every morning. Parking was ample and convenient. The pools were the perfect temperature for the slightly cool mornings. The staff was congenial and went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. And you have to experience the mud bath. It's a "once in a lifetime".

Reviews.Title: “Always Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: janicetrips
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Roman Spa for several years on the recomendation of our friends and family. We always refer people to this hotel because it is always a pleasurable experience. The location is fantastic, as you are within walking distance to great restaurants and shops. The mineral pools are always at the perfect temperature, and never crowded! The rooms accomodate every need, you can get a kitchen or even an indoor hot tub in your room. There is also an indoor pool to accomodate the people who need to stay out of the sun. If you are truly lloking to enjoy yourself, relax, and heal at the same time this is the place for you! Don't forget to have a message or facial to really pamper yourself which is located right behind the spa, at The Oassis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools-our favorite spot in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: tahohix
Reviews.Content: We have being going to the Roman Spa for years and it is our favorite place for a 2-3 day get-a-way. We traveled though a snow storm from Lake Tahoe to get there and couldn't wait to get in the pools as soon as we checked in. We requested and got one of the rooms upstairs overlooking the pools, great view of the mountains and the quint city hall of Calistoga. The location of the Roman Spa is excellent for walking to any of the fine resturants in town plus the local supermarket. It's also a quick drive to any number of wineriers, which is an other reason we go there. This time we headed north on Hwy. 128 into the Alexander Valley to visit a few wineries, a beautiful drive on a windy road. Our main reason for staying there is the well maintained grounds and the three mineral pools. The one indoor pool is great for soaking with it's jacuzzi jets and a nice sauna to bake in. But I love the outdoor pool sitting next to the hot tub. Hopping into the 104 degree hot tub and then into the larger cooler big pool for a swim is great. A super place to soak and relax and of course enjoy the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Getaway From It All”
Reviews.Author: Renee'sadventures
Reviews.Content: I have been sneeking off to The Roman Spa for over 20 years now. Whenever I need a recharging or to put my thoughs in order and get peace in my life, I head to The Roman Spa for just a few days. The rooms are clean, quiet and spacious plus affordable. Their grounds are well tended with colorful flowers and a great variety of green exotic plants nestled with the sound of gentle flowing water fountains. The most rewarding features are the three wonderful, relaxing natural mineral baths. Each bath is kept at a comfortable warm to hot temperature with several stimulating jets both indoors or outdoors. If all of that is not enough, the Oasis Spa is right next store offering the most relaxing and experienced natural body and facial treatments around including mud baths, mineral baths, all types of massages, and facials that will make you look and feel several years younger. Every time I come home from the Roman Spa I have energy to burn and a great attitude to go with it. I am always planning my next trip back there as soon as I arrive home. You certainly cannot get enough of a good thing, and that is what The Roman Spa is for me. Try it and ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hot Mineral Water Soak:)”
Reviews.Author: SalseraLA
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this delightful hot springs spa was just what we needed to relax and rest after our recent wedding. While the February weather was chilly and rainy, it did nothing to deter us from soaking in the hot mineral baths and enjoying the saunas. The hotel environment is cozy, simple and quiet which allows for a low personal maintenance and relaxation. It was especially romantic to sit in the hot jacuzzi and watch the rain drops fall. Swimming slow, easy laps in the big pool was the prefect way to cool down from the hot tubs and simply laze around. Our room was clean and comfortable with a mini refrigerator to keep our wine and cheese cool. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our time at Roman's and would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Take Me Away!”
Reviews.Author: rscalc
Reviews.Content: Do you remember the "Calgon, take me away," commercials? This is like - Roman Spa take me away! So nice to dip into the hot mineral pool and let go of the cares of this world. Relaxing atmosphere, always friendly and helpful staff. This was our 5th time here in the last 13 years and we will be back sooner than later. Walking distance to excellent food. The rooms are basic, but clean, the grounds are well kept. Enjoyed a massage at the Oasis as well. Good times!

Reviews.Title: “Magic at Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: BernadetteCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is a beautiful, nurturing, peaceful place to spend a weekend or longer. The grounds are beautifully maintained with lush plants, koi ponds, hummingbird feeders, and picnic tables. The mineral pools are the highlight of the property, and are even more inviting combined with the other amenities mentioned above. We had several in our group and they all agreed that this lodging was really special. The one block walk to downtown Calistoga, with its excellent shopping and restaurants, combined with the wine country appeal make this one of my favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second TIme At Roman Spa. DS”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGetaway42
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort and were not disappointed. The rooms and grounds are clean and well taken care of. We enjoyed the pools most of all. The warm water makes it a perfect place to enjoy an evening swim. This will be an annual destination.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return again.”
Reviews.Author: ScotsinCal
Reviews.Content: We live several hours from Calistoga and enjoy the mineral pools, mud baths, wine country and food in the area. After staying at other hotels and being disappointed we found the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort and have returned every year. It’s an older resort but is kept up meticulously. The staff is friendly and the entire stay a joy. Many good restaurants are within walking distance. We can’t wait to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler020
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nicely decorated, a little noisy, but we ran the fan so we wouldn't hear the neighbors tv. We had a kitchen to cook our own meals, and spent alot of time in the 3 mineral pools. THe grounds are nice, with lots of trees and plants, and a BBQ area. We looked at other hotels in the area when we went for a walk, and decided this one was the nicest!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: jknet
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort 2/26/07 We just got back from a quick weekend get away. It was cold and rainy but we loved the Roman Spa because we were immersed in the soothing warm mineral baths. It was wonderful to feel the cool rain on your face with the warm water enveloping your body. The room was very comfortable and quiet. It was a very relaxing weekend. The staff was knowledgable and helpful. We can't wait to find the time to go back.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pacifcan
Reviews.Content: my mom and 5 year old daughter stayed here for 2 nights. we paid for a double w/ a kitchen for about 150. i was surprised how roomy it was and we used the kitchen for every meal except one dinner. the mineral pools were therapeutic for my feet and muscles. the pool area was very nice with flowers, hummingbirds and CLEAN. the big pool outside is at a very comfortable temperature [92 ish? ] ,the hottub 104 and the indoor pool was about 98. they were all awesome! it is a place to relax and most of the guests respect that. we will go again with the whole family next time. the only disappointing experience was my facial at the oasis spa, i guess i have had much better. i would go somewhere else for that and the massage pretty good. romans is the perfect get away.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: romanspafans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are huge fans of the Roman Spa. The staff is extremely helpful and the facilities are clean, comfortable, and affordable. We love the landscaping and the three mineral pools. We have been coming to the Roman Spa for almost ten years. They have excellent weekday specials.

Reviews.Title: “The mineral Springs are Awesome”
Reviews.Author: jack.goodwin
Reviews.Content: 2/28/7: We just returned from a very relaxing trip up to the Napa Valley. Our stay at the Roman Spa was perfect for what we had in mind. A little wine tasting by day, then return to a very soothing soak in their 3 mineral pools. Your skin feels so soft after a few hours in the pools. It's also a great way to start the day as well. The rooms are OK, nothing fancy, but clean. The grounds are very nice and well maintained. Excellent selection of plantings. The location is at the very end of the Napa valley, so it is away from most of the crowd. The town is is very quient with some good restraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Annual retreat”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler7
Reviews.Content: This is where we go for an annual retreat--rooms are clean and the grounds are beautiful even in the dead of winter. Sitting in the hot water with the rain falling upon your head is delightful! Once our car is parked and unloaded, it stays parked. It's walking the rest of the weekend to all the wonderful restaurants and to The Candy Cellar for incredible fudge and candies from long ago. The walk across the parking lot to get a massage is also a big plus. We also enjoy that there are usually only adults around. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we enjoy ours.

Reviews.Title: “As Sweet as the Wine !”
Reviews.Author: dave213b
Reviews.Content: A two day stay at this wonderful Spa was like 2 days in heaven! The staff is exceedingly helpful, with insights to different wineries, day trips and local spas. The hotel is impressively clean with no detail overlooked. This was my 4th visit and i will definitley be back. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magical waters”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoSheba
Reviews.Content: Take a break from the mad and rushed world. Step back into a time of pure relaxation. The pools sparkel, the water is magical, the staff is present and the towels are pentiful. Whatever the season, the Roman Spa is a lovely retreat with a lush and tropical landscape.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny and Steamy”
Reviews.Author: Caspar7
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa is tucked away one from down town Calistoga. Quietly located across from a historical building, it is conveniently located to shops, restaurants, a market, art galleries, and book stores. At night it is quiet. The gardens at the Spa are beautifully tended. Many waterfalls or fountains created a peaceful and serene atmosphere. The soaking and swimming pools are small but I never felt crowded. Three pools offer temperatures from warm to hot with the jacuzzi being the hottest of the three. It is wonderful to sit outside in the sun. Deck chairs and recliners are located throughout the Spa grounds for relaxing. A picnic and Bar-B-Que area is equipped with Weber stoves and the items necessary to have a fun outdoor dinner. At night the pools are softly lit and the night sky, midnight blue when we visited, is filled with stars. Coffee is organic Thanksgiving coffee sustainably grown. Instead of those tedius little pots in each room, you can walk to the office and enjoy as much coffee as you like. Our room did not have a kitchenette but did have a refrigerator. We enjoyed lunch and breakfast (fruits and salads) during the day time at the Spa but ate dinner in town. The staff is friendly and our maid spoke both English and Spanish. She was very helpful when we asked her to make up a couch into a day bed. We love the Roman Spa. This is our 15th year of visiting the Spa. I would recommend the Roman Spa to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Three Decades at Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: drummer46
Reviews.Content: I've been going to The Roman Spa for over 30 years. It is a great place with very friendly staff. The rooms and grounds are kept very clean by a hard working personnel. I especially like soaking in the indoor pool. Thumbs up for the Roman Spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to return to over and over”
Reviews.Author: racingelcamino
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at Roman Spa in Napa Valley, Calistoga, CA. The friendly atmosphere and beautiful grounds make you feel at home the minute you arrive. The three heated spring pools, one large pool, one hot tub and an indoor pool will satisfy everyone's soaking environment. It is fun to sit in the pool and meet people from all over the world. The little town of Calistoga is just a block away and shopping is to "die for". There are restaurants with just about any kind of cuisine. There are many nearby wineries to visit and the scenery is magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite place”
Reviews.Author: lCa
Reviews.Content: the roman spa in calistoga is my favorite place. the pools are always the perfect temperature no matter what the weather is i always have a great time. everything is in walking distance shopping, great restaurants, live music, spa treatments even a grocery store with gourmet snacks. once we get there we never drive again until we leave. and i always feel so relaxed i always wonder why i don't come here more often.

Reviews.Title: “Will Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2 night trip with my best friend. We both really enjoyed the Roman Spa's atmosphere. Very clean rooms, relaxing courtyards, and nice staff. My only complaint would be the noisy guests congregating close to our room since our room was near the parking lot (which got noisy at times) and guests talking on their cell phones in the courtyard in front of our room while we tried to relax. Oh, and I unplugged the fridge both nights because it was very loud! It is a great location. About 10 steps from Wappo's Restaurant, where we had dinner the first night. We went to Brannan's the second night, and Cafe Sarifornia for breakfast the last day. Sorry to report that we had great food but horrible service at all 3 places! I would recommend going back to the Roman Spa, but try to make it clear that you are looking for a relaxing weekend (so try to get a room tucked away from the pools and the parking lots!)

Reviews.Title: “Great for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: crazyaboutravel
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Roman Spa for about 18-20 years. It has been great for relaxation. And gathering with friends. I love the hot water spas the pool is always keeped warm 96-98 degrees. there is a picnic table area and porch tables scattered throughout the complex. If your going to stay long it's nice to have the kitchen. needs some updating though. As it has a 70s feel. but clean and well kept. although i noticed this time that the pool had some brown discoloration around the perimiter.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the ambience and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: a_crocheter
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on the web and stopped for one night on our way to Vallejo from Chico. Would love to go back as Calistoga is a really neat little town with lots of good restaurants and shops. One night isn't really enough to be able to rate the motel much, but our room was very nice, it was quiet as the pools close at 10:00 and there is a choice of three pools depending on the temperature you prefer. We had forgotten our swimming suits and the hotel maintains some suits that have been left behind for more than 3 months and launders them for forgetful people like us! We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Two Days of Bliss”
Reviews.Author: aldeb-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a great time. We have stayed at the Roman Spay several times over the last 20 years and always come away relaxed and refreashed. It is clearly the best place to stay in Calistoga if you're looking for a Romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the roman spa”
Reviews.Author: flowerfriend
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roman Spa for two nights and I wish I coud have been there longer. The pools were very nice - large enough for the guests without being crowded and a nice variety of temperatures. The setting is pretty and the ambiance was very soothing. The spa is centrally located for all sorts of entertainments in Sonoma county. I am already looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Getaway Spot”
Reviews.Author: charleskathryn
Reviews.Content: We are long time Roman Spa devotees. It is always a wonderful experience. The rooms are comfortable, quiet, and spotless. The 3 different pools are perhaps our favorite, however. We love to go when it is raining and float in the big pool with the rain gently coming down. The arbor is full of hummingbirds in season and the fountains and landscaping are always meticulous. You park and just walk to fabulous restaurants and shops in Calistoga. Roman Spa even gave us a discount coupon for the Flatiron Grill this time. We loved our latest stay. Some small improvement is always noticeable each time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Calistoga Spa (Sacramento visitor)”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoDayTripper
Reviews.Content: We have been enjoying the Roman Spa since 1984 and our visit in January was just as enjoyable. The three mineral pools range from approximatley 95 degrees to 105 degrees so everyone has a choice. The grounds are well maintained with the main outdoor pool surrounded by flowers, shrubs and trees. The warm waters are so relaxing, one always feels rejuvenated after spending time here. The rooms have undergone renovation and are very clean and quiet. This is definitely still our favorite place to unwind in Calistoga. With shops and resturants a short walk away, your car stays put.

Reviews.Title: “Mystical Mist Fills Us with Wonder!!!”
Reviews.Author: PortugeseRose
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I just returned home after a two-night stay at the Roman Spa. As usual, it was invigorating to our senses and filled us with a sense of wonder. Even in the chilly winter air, it is a mystical and magical place with the steam rising from the clear-blue mineral water. The temperature of the main pool is just right for lying on our backs, doing leisurely laps or standing by the side. While in the pool, the plants and flowers surround us like a Tropical Paradise. Yesterday we were looking deep within the Blue Spruce tree for the whirring of wings of a humming bird. I cannot speak highly enough of this place, for it is perfect for friends, couples, families or even coming solo for a refreshing get-away. It feels like coming home every time we return, for the ambience of the place, the decor of the rooms and the warm hospitality of the staff are inviting to our weary bodies/spirits. If you want a vacation filled with adventure, relaxation, sensual delights, and connection with the local shops/ restaurants, then this is the place for you! Enjoy!!!! Alameda, CA

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: samantha_s
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly and had an early check in. The rooms are super clean and comfortable. The pool is small but nicely landscaped to feel like an "oasis". The water temperture was perfect. The best feature is how close the hotel is to the center of town- just a few steps away to our favorite restaurant, Wappo Grill, and the wonderful coffee shop, museum and park. Makes it a super pleasant and easy get-away for a night in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: CANiceNeasy
Reviews.Content: When we go to the Roman Spa in Calistoga our main objective is to relax. The large main pool is what first meets the eye. However, during our stay we also relax in the indoor pool and the outside jacuzzi. We have continued to return to the Roman Spa for over twenty years because of its consistency for: cleanliness, upkeep, the 3 temperature pools, free morning coffee, and close proximity to the town of Calistoga. The guests and the workers are all friendly. We have alwa;ys enjoyed our visit and hope to for many years.

Reviews.Title: “The "Rip Off" Spa”
Reviews.Author: cbd22
Reviews.Content: This place isn't a real spa or a resort at all. It is a motel with a brown mineral pool that they add chlorine to. The gardens look like they haven't been watered in weeks and the fish in the ponds look as desperate to get out of the place as I did. The price was outstandingly expensive for the type of quality I recieved. They don't even have iron and ironing boards in the rooms. They have coffee pots, but no coffee and when you step into the rooms it's as if you were stepping back into the early 80's. This place needs a drastic renovation. It's a Motel 6 type quality place. They also have no high speed internet. Now I understand why they don't have any pictures on their website. They are losing their clientele and I absolutely understand why. I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend or enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: mdl95003
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime AAA member, and try to patronize the establishments that are AAA rated, have great settings, and which located in scenic but easy to get to locations. This little gem of a hotel meets all those criteria and more, and as a result we come here two to three times a year for long weekend respites from life in the Silicon Valley/South Bay area. Because it is located in the center of town, all you need to do after arrival is park your car for the weekend. Within one short block you can find good restaurants, wine tasting, day spas, a great independent bookshop, art galleries, a weekend farmers market (in season) and gourmet pastry, free wireless internet service, and Flying Goat coffee at the Calistoga Creamery and Bakery at 1353 Lincoln Ave. The hotel itself is clean, well maintained, and staffed by friendly people. The pool is not large, but is nicely situated and surrounded by greenery. Hot tubs are soothing, and there are multiple options for on and offsite spa and esthetician services. This is a great place to stay at a reasonable price. Suitable for families or a quick romantic getaway. Some rooms have kitchenettes, and barbeques and picnic tables allow for easy outdoor grilling. Enjoy, but book early for holiday/peak periods, it is a busy and popular spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: irishE
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations to stay for a particular day and due to my husband having his days off changed made a request to change the reservation after the official time allowed. We also had my sister and her husband in another room on the same reservation. They were very gracious about accommodating us. The property is beautiful and the pools well maintained. The only thing I missed was in room coffee. The beautiful flowers more than made up for that small inconvenience. We have stayed there in the past and have always enjoyed it very much and it is out favorite place to stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights rest at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: santacruzin'
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teenage daughters and myself just returned from three nights at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort in Calistoga. The staff was very friendly and provided us with discount coupons for several of the upscale restaurants all located within just a block of the resort. Our room was pleasant and clean as were the grounds. We spent many hours enjoying both the outdoor thermal mineral pool (heated to 96 degrees) and the indoor thermal mineral pool (heated to 100 degrees). Both pools were spacious and uncrowded.
