My daughter and I had massages at the Oasis Spa located just across the parking lot. Talk about a good nights rest after all this! We also enjoyed strolling through the picturesque town of Calistoga and, for those so inclined, there are numerous wineries offering samples and product within a few miles of the resort. We definitely look forward to our next visit to the Roman Spa Resort in the beautiful Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: kkwTracy
Reviews.Content: In August and December of this year, my mom, sister, & I stayed at the Roman Spa. Every year for the past 15 years we have met at the Roman Spa and enjoy a 3 night stay. We absolutely have a great time. Relaxing in the warm pool, enjoying the jets in the hot tubs, inside and out, and enjoying every minute of spa time. We always reserve a room with a kitchen so we can enjoy our meals outside on the patio. There are many reasons why we keep returning to stay at the Roman Spa. Beautiful plants and very clean grounds, hot coffee and cookies in the lobby every morning, squeaky clean pools, endless supply of towels, great maid service, and a massage/spa business a few feet away. We have everything we need. Yes, we wlll continue to return to the Roman Spa because they do spoil us rotten and we love it. Thank you Roman Spa for being a great place to stay. signed Karen

Reviews.Title: “Come back every year”
Reviews.Author: kahty
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this spa. I come back there a couple of times a year for over 10 years. The mineral waters are great for my arthritus. I usually bring a grandson with me. We love the big pool and the indoor hot tub and the gardens are great with picnic tables and BBQ. It is quiet and restfrul. Thanks for providing us with a edelightful place.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: malarak
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Roman Spa for over twenty years, so we are very familiar with the property. While there are some things that are lacking about the Roman Spa, our overall experience has always been a positive one, and that’s what keeps us coming back again and again even as other hotels and motels open up in the area. We agree with a previous poster that to characterize the rooms as “resort” style is an overstatement. The rooms are comfortable but quite basic, and there is nothing to suggest a resort of the type you might find in Hawaii or Mexico. There are no bathrobes and slippers; there is no deluxe bed with high threadcount sheets; the towels are adequate but not plush; and you get a simple bottle of conditioning shampoo plus a plastic tote bag for your wet swimwear rather than the array of exotic shampoo, conditioner, and lotion that you find elsewhere. We also agree with a previous poster that the air conditioning/heating unit is noisy – something we have noted for all of the years of our stays. So why do we return? First, while the rooms are basic, they are always impeccably clean. We usually get a unit with a kitchen, and that provides the convenience of being able to prepare meals and store and reheat leftovers from our meals at a local restaurant. Second, while Calistoga is not a large town, the Roman Spa is at nearly the exact midpoint. It is one short block from the commercial main street, so there is virtually no traffic or traffic noise but you are one minute from exploring the shops or heading out to dinner. Third, while the rooms themselves are very simple, I have to argue that the gardens and the pools are the main attractions. The gardens change seasonally, and they are always a pleasure. There are different areas on the property – one with a fountain and tables where people sit and have a drink or play cards – one with a grill where people gather to cook dinner and eat at picnic tables – a grape arbor, which provides a shady place to relax on a recliner on a sunny day – and recliners around the outdoor pools for those who want sun. Interspersed everywhere are seasonal and permanent plantings. In winter, there are generally lots of cyclamens and poinsettias; in the spring, pots of bulbs are everywhere; in summer, there is a riot of color from a vast assortment of perennials; and in the fall, there are pumpkins and other fall color. There are three pools fed from mineral springs – a larger outdoor one that is warm enough for swimming in the winter but cool enough for lounging in the summer – a medium one indoors that is the perfect hotness for long relaxing soaks – and a small round hot Jacuzzi next to the large outdoor pool for those who like it pretty hot. There are also saunas in the two bathrooms next to the medium indoor pool. As you can probably guess, when we stay at the Roman Spa, we are generally not in our room, soaking in a pool or sitting in a quite place reading a book. In conclusion, the Roman Spa is definitely not a luxury resort, but it has remained a place of rest and relaxation for us for more than two decades.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Hot Springs Is Just An Old Motel.”
Reviews.Author: rollinalong
Reviews.Content: The website for the Roman Spa Motel promises gardens, spas, and "European Style Lodging", but it nothing more than an older motel with ordinary pools and a few plants. Everything looked run down, especially their scary "full service spa" building at the back of the property. The bed sheets were rough, the mattress was stiff, and there were very few amenities -- this is not what I would call a "resort". I feel that their website is misleading. And, in spite of the glowing reviews you think you're finding here, just go through the list a bit, especially the oldest posts...you'll find many people who agree with what we experienced. We were hoping there would be an ironing board and iron in our room. When we called to request them, we were told that they were out of irons! They were also lacking in other basic amenities. This Motel needs to improve their noisy A/C units. It has poor sound insulation, and I was kept awake by other guests all during the night. The place appears to have been built sometime back in the 1960's or older, which would account for the lack of noise insulation. The pool might be heated with the aid of a natural geothermal aquafer, but the pools aren't filled with pure water from it - they smell of chlorine. We couldn't wait to leave the next morning. There are better, less expensive accomodations near by in Calistoga, look for them.

Reviews.Title: “nice spa”
Reviews.Author: BPaul
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our visit. It was rainy, but the pools were hot and comfortable despite the weather. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love the peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: breeko
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Roman Spa for the past 25 years. We make about 3 visits per year. The place has the most beautiful grounds and is always very clean. The staff is very friendly and always go out of their way to make everything perfect. Thr rooms are very clean, modern and always cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Looked Forward to Getting Home....”
Reviews.Author: rainbowbee
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to advise readers that the words "spa" and "resort" are freely bandied around in relation to the motels in Calistoga, and somehow I missed that when researching the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort. (The word "motel" is on their sign, seen if you go directly to their site online.) This is an important distinction that I overlooked - a Motel as opposed to a Hotel - and this evidences itself in terms of austerity in accomodations. All the glowing reviews on this site caused me to abandon a more comprehensive research, so I'd like to give a very thorough review so people can make up their minds with a variety of info. I was hoping for a hot springs soak, and a rejuvenating stay at this "resort". I left feeling very tired and discouraged. The pros are that indeed, the staff is friendly, the grounds and rooms are clean, and the springs are used to full advantage, whether you rent a private whirlpool room as I did, or wish to avail yourself to the pool or hot tub outside. The cons of the place? I was a bit unhappy to detect the scent of chlorine in the outside pool, thinking I would be getting the same unadulterated hot spring soak as I could get in my room. It would have been easier to revel in a body of water that is "pure" hot springs water, rather than swimming in something with chemicals in it. But the water was nice, the moon was full, and I continued to try to get into the spirit of my retreat. Back in my room, my partner and I excitedly tried to use our new laptop for the first time...he had bid on an auction item online that was due to close. (I admit that not asking the Roman Spa Motel whether or not they had wireless internet service is my own fault, but since I've seen the rankest little motels advertising it, I erroneously assumed they would have it.) We went to the office to see if there was a complimentary PC for guests, but this was not the case either. I was also able to let this detail go, and my partner and I slipped into the whirlpool in our room. This was a nice feature, hot, pure sulpher-smelling water filled the nicely clean tub...but I was disappointed that the tub wasn't just a bit deeper. My partner and I are small people, so if you're a big guy, be advised that in a sitting position, your shoulders will be way above the water line. Scooching down into the tub, we found it difficult to find a comfortable position and hung the back of our necks on the squared edge of the tub. Romance was not to be....We retired to a hard mattress, and closed the curtains that didn't block out the light from outside to our satisfaction. During the night, we finally surrendered and shut off the window-heater-conditioner unit that vibrated and clanked every time it came on...so I woke up cold the next morning. Huddling under the blankets to attempt the last couple hours of precious rest, I was disturbed by the sounds of maids using the laundry next to my room, and the distinct sounds of another guest in an adjoining room, stirring something in a cup and speaking. I was amazed that the walls were so thin! Getting up with sore hips from the hard mattress, I searched the room in vain for a coffee maker...another amenity I guess I've been taking for granted. I guess in short, even if my destination has some charm and the draw of natural features, if I can't get a good night's rest, I won't be inclined to return. Hope this review helps someone's decision-making.

Reviews.Title: “Coming home”
Reviews.Author: 1siobhan
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Roman Spa for almost twenty years. It's been my sanctuary from the stresses of life. There is serious healing in the "waters". They have an indoor pool and an outdoor pool with jacuzzi, all filled with warm mineral spring water. A sauna is available if you get tired of soaking. The landscaping induces serenity . The rooms are clean and comfortable. My only suggestion for improvement would be better/ more lighting in the rooms. Oh, yes, there is coffe and tea for their guests every morning. Honestly, the worst part about the Roman Spa is having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - just what we needed!!!”
Reviews.Author: soulmamma
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this resort. It was once again a real treat. The folks at the desk are helpful and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The pools and tub was hot and relaxing. We love that we can walk to town for dinner. That is the best!!! Everytime we come to the wine country we will look forward to staying at this Resort. Mary Pritchard, Carlsbad, CA

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: LJB1234
Reviews.Content: My stay was for two nights. The rooms were quite nice and the grounds decent. I was with a group of 3 other girls and we would have enjoyed it more if the pools had stayed opened a little later. Though, I can understand why they don't as there are guest rooms near the pools. The room rate was $179.00, which I thought to be just a little pricey for the accommodations. Would I stay there again...... yes. Calistoga is a great little town to hang out in and there are some fabulous shops and places to hang out. The food and wine is all first rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: GelosiGirls
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Roman Spa. We took advantage of the Manager's Special, which was advertised on the internet. We loved our spacious room, delicious breakfast at Sarafornia Cafe, and the mineral pools. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & relaxing”
Reviews.Content: We have been to Roman Spa numerous times and have always enjoyed it. We love the mineral pools and the attention to the exterior spaces, which feel like a small villa's courtyards. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. The resort is located in town so you can walk to any place, including at least 5 great restaurants, in downtown Calistoga in a matter of minutes. I agree with other reviewers - it's not a partier's place. Come with the intention to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday Spa Destinatiion”
Reviews.Author: Pumplin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the facility to be greeted by the most beautiful gardens ( the hotels website pics don't do the hotel justice) you could ever imagine and my quest for the Perfect Spa Birthday Destination came true! You see I had searched for weeks for the PERFECT SPA as my best friend of 15 yrs.had just been diagnosed with a terminal blood disease leaving her severely anemic. Halloween is her birthday and yr after yr we have always celebrated together since our divorses by getting into costume and going dancing. Since that wasn't a option this yr. I decided to take her on vacation. So we got on thinking caps on & decided Calistoga was the place to go as we usto live in Sonoma Co. But we only did the day spa stuff and I needed a hotel that allowed her to smoke outside and had resturants,spas and shops very close by. I looked at websites for weeks and finally decided on Roman Spa although it wasn't the 4 star treatment I wanted but it had a handicapped room and since I have arthritis real bad I thought lets go for it. Well like I said boy what a suprise it was to find this jewel. The hotel is older but excellently maintained & very clean with 3 mineral pools and a spa on site. When you need something close by it is only doors away as the hotel is centrally located in town. We could talk only a few door down to a varity of resturants. In thier garden are covered tables & chairs with even a BBQ area for singles, familites or lg. groups with picnic tables. All rooms come with a frig.& wine glasses ( a must in wine country) some have complete kitchens perfect for long stays is you don't want to eat out every meal. But our room was perfect with a double & single bed. The Oasis Spa is on the premises a gave us superb treatment on Halloween for her birthday we both relaxed in a bath treatment and got a facial followed by a massage. Our attendant was excellent. In the mornings you can walk around the corner to a wonderful bakery for treats( although I drove not knowing it was that close). We loved POOL HOPPING. In the evenings the indoor pool was our favorite although it is not the hottest. The have bathrooms with saunas indoors, so we loved taking off our bathing suits in the evenings in there then jumping in the sauna to warm up before putting on robes back on. Oh yes this is the place to bring a robe because you will live in a robe & bathing suit. Come rain or come shine this is the place to be. We celebrated with champage on her birthday before going to dinner at Brannans to have a heavenly dinner that was definately 4 star, and only steps from our hotel. On our 3 day we tried the Spa accross the street. Yes the is another spa steps from you. We walked across the street in our robes & we had a wonderful massage & facial. They also do 1 1/2 pedicures. Can you immagine how devine that must be. I know our massage & facial was heavenly. We ate dinner at Checkers down the street from Brannans. on our 4th day we had to return home and vowed our trip wasn't long enough! We truely believe a 3 star rating Roman Spa may be but it deserves your attention! As we will be back soon, thats for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxation guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: dukeofdaddy
Reviews.Content: When we visit the Calistoga area, we like to stay at the Roman Spa and Hot Springs Resort. It not only provides a pleasant atmosphere with its well kept flower gardens, maintained grounds, pools , saunas and clean fresh rooms. It also places us in walking distance to excellent dining, exclusive shops and on site spa. When the mood is to relax, we pick up tasty delicacies from the well stocked corner store and kick back to relax with a favorite wine from a local winery along the Silverado trail in Napa Valley. Garry and Donna Cook

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, As Usual!”
Reviews.Author: Morningdo
Reviews.Content: I just had to stay, once again, at the Roman Spa, and I was not disappointed. My travels brought me to Calistoga earlier than expected on the day of arrival, and the staff was friendly and helpful, and allowed me to check into my room early (as the room was ready). I was travelling with a friend, who had never been there before, and she, too, was very pleased with her experience. The room was clean, the towels were sumptuous, the pool was warm, and the hot tub, delightful. The Roman Spa is so conveniently located that we parked our car and walked everywhere we needed to go - for two days!! We were able to walk to several vineyards as well. Most importantly, the value for the money is one of the reasons I continue to stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Every Time”
Reviews.Author: Wordchaser
Reviews.Content: We live in Napa and for many years we have been loyal fans of the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort. We stay here several times each year and every visit is perfect. The mineral pools are wonderful, the gardens enchanting and the rooms are elegant and spacious. We highly recommend this resort to all who want to relax in a lovely environment.

Reviews.Title: “Total R&R”
Reviews.Author: DH2571
Reviews.Content: I consider The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort my second home as it is at the top of my list of places to stay for complete rest and relaxation. I make at least 2 trips a year there and have been doing so for the last 10-12 years. What makes this place feel so much like home and a place I always want to return are a variety of reasons. It is a quaint resort with separate small buildings not more than 2 stories high spread out on the grounds. Truely a cozy atmosphere. Everywhere you look there are flowers planted, fountains, ponds with multicolored fish, a few palm trees, an arbor covered with grape leaves and many varieties of foliage throughout the grounds. During special holidays they decorate the grounds which helps to give one the feel of that holiday. I was there shortly after Halloween and the place was strewn with pumpkins and cornstalks. The Roman Spa is clean, clean, clean! Not only are the nicely appointed, colonial style rooms spotless but also the grounds outside. I've seen the workers clean even the outside banisters, door handles, windows, lounge chairs, picnic tables, etc. You could take a white glove inside as well as outside and not turn up a speck of dirt. One of the highlights of The Roman Spa are its warm mineral pools that you could just soak in all day. You have a choice of either an outdoor or indoor pool and the outdoor hot tub. There is even a dry sauna as well. The best part of all is that these immenities are included in the price of your room which are extremely resonable. Many of the people you meet when you stay here are repeat visitors. I've met some that have been returning for the last 20-30 years. I know why. Everyone you meet, whether at the front desk or those soaking in the mineral pools are friendly and engaging. I even met my fiance' here as we struck up a conversation while soaking in the warm waters of the outdoor pool. We make this place our anniversary getaway. The Roman Spa is only a block away from the main street where there are a multitude of restaurants to choose from. I love leaving my car in the parking stall most of the time I'm there and just walking a few steps to good food, drink and entertainment and not worrying about driving back to my room after I've enjoyed sharing a nice bottle of wine. I could go on and on..... The Roman Spa is wonderful to say the least!!!!

Reviews.Title: “roman spa repeat”
Reviews.Author: panhead
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Roman Spa In Calistoga for the past 15 years, tried others but this is the best. Rooms with or without kitchens are very clean and reasonable. Service is great and the grounds are like a garden setting. Outdoor pool and spa plus indoor pool. Across the street from the mueseum and a block from downtown, you have it all.

Reviews.Title: “a great relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: ed1310donna
Reviews.Content: Calistoga Nov. 8 & 9th, 2006 This was our second visit, having stayed only one night last year. Very relaxing experience. Enjoyed all of the pools and the other guests. Grounds were very clean. The room was very clean, but the bed was not comfortable and the pillows were too hard. This will not deter us from coming back. Staff was very friendly. Looking forward to our third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Another Enjoyable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: HopalongGang
Reviews.Content: There's something to be said about returning year after year to the same locale, especially when there are so many places to choose from in the Napa Valley region. The Roman Spa offers a most comfortable and relaxing atmosphere in which to unwind and temporarily leave your troubles behind. The Roman Spa offers a total of three heated pools (of varying temperatures) which should please every personal preference. The rooms are clean and nicely appointed, with kitchens available in some of the suites. The staff at Roman Spa is always friendly; there are familiar faces each year, which indicates that it must be a nice place to work as well as visit! For the most part, the Spa is a quiet place, where a person can choose to be as quiet and introspective or as outgoing and social as you are comfortable with. We have stayed in the Calistoga area for ten years. While we have visited other spas/resorts, we have always chosen the Roman Spa. Why change when you've found what suits you best?

Reviews.Title: “Happy to be Back”
Reviews.Author: rondafonda
Reviews.Content: It was a delight to return to the Roman Spa. In the past we were more frequent visitors but lately we've been so busy we just couldn't get away. We booked room 141 for two nights, we were happy with it, king size bed, fridge, plenty of room. We decided to stay an extra night but our room had been reserved, so we changed to another location. The next room #120, is inside the pool area. It was smaller, queen size bed, but since it was for the last night we didn't mind that. We did mind that the room couldn't be ventilated properly. Probably because it was near all the pools the fumes permeated our room making it hard to breath. We did turn on the air conditioner, but that caused the room to be too cold. In spite of it all I would still stay at the Roman Spa, only next time we'll make sure we have a room we like. Considering it was raining the entire time we still had a wonderful visit. A nice touch was the friendly staff and the umbrellas provided by the spa. Ronda Bonati

Reviews.Title: “The Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: RomanSpa
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay. I didn't want to leave! Very clean and beautiful spa. The staff was great and the water was perfect. We will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: oaxaca1
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa was just what we hoped for ... excellent pools, a comfortable room, and a short block from "downtown" Calistoga. We were there once before, a few years ago, and it seemed better this time ... and I liked it well enough the first time. The room was perfectly clean and the grounds were well taken care of. There was plenty of room to sit in sun or shade, both by the pools and away from the pools, in separate patio areas.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: snow1093
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day 2 night stay at the Roman Spa. We stayed in a 2 queen bedroom w/kitchen. There was a nearby grocery store that you can buy allot of delicious food that you can take back to the room and cook yourself. It was fun preparing food in the room. If you preffer to eat out, there are very nice restaurants nearby that have linen table cloths and napkins. We enjoyed the miniral pool that was heated to 95 degrees. The weather was not too sunny and it rained almost all the time we were there, but it was a fun experiance swimming in the warm water and having the cool rain hit your face. The staff was very friendly. The room and kitchen were very clean. There was a laundry facility but we did not need it. I liked it that everything was walking distance. This is a good place if you want just to relax and get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Cowgirls”
Reviews.Author: kzive
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is an excellent Hotel for groups of people to gather and visit. My friends and I have been going to this Hotel for over 10 years and we will be going back soon. The atmosphere is quiet and relaxed with three different hot pools to relax in. The staff is alway nice and they put out wonderful coffee in the AM so you can get a cup and jump in the water and start your day relaxed. The location is great too because there are several great restaurants within walking distance so no hassles with cars. The shopping is fun and its just a short drive to check out different wine makers. Always a fun weekend. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cclo
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth stay at the Roman Spa, all of which were total delights. The staff are very accommodating, the rooms are comfortable, and best of all, the hot pools are clean and not busy. The view from many of the rooms is charming and from the pools is just what you come to Calistoga for. We will come back again and again. The price is right, the atmosphere is lovely and the guests are interesting and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Motel with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: Mendobabe
Reviews.Content: While the pool was nice and rooms were clean, the people who run this place are so cheap they would not even put a coffee pot in the room, or shampoo/skin lotion, or drinking water. And, since the front desk is closed from 9:00 PM till 8:00AM --, there is no chance of getting any of these items there. And, in the morning, when I asked about it, the front desk clerk was ruder than rude, completely unapologetic about the fact that, for close to $200 a night, you don't even get drinking water! I can't say the place sucks, but the attitude sure does!

Reviews.Title: “Natural Springs were wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jennette1
Reviews.Content: This Inn is probably the best for your money in Calistoga - understand that it is a very (and I stress very) small town and most of the hotels and inns were built in the 70's. My husband and I thought this place did a great job for the money. I've stayed at hot spring resorts in Arizona and Palm Springs so I know what a resort looks like - I wouldn't call this a resort but it did have three fabulous hot springs of different temps and there were not children in the pools. Of course I could have just lucked out with that. Anyway, we had a wonderful time. We stayed in room 134 which is upstairs and has a massive whirlpool (largest one I have seen in a small inn) that has natural spring water coming thru the tap. I loved that the best. The service was great, the atmosphere was wonderful, walking distance to all the shops and restaurants, the bed wasn't the best but we would stay at the Roman Spa again.

Reviews.Title: “The mineral pools rule - great value!”
Reviews.Author: missribs
Reviews.Content: Roman is a great value for what you get. they have 3 pools, all of which are filled with water pumped in directly from calistoga mineral water sources. the main outdoor pool is about bath water temp., the hot tub (also outdoor) is about 104 degrees, and the indoor, mid-sized pool has a temperature inbetween the other two pools. they also have separate men's and women's saunas, which are located next to the lockers in the bathrooms (next to the mid-sized pool). pools are open until 10pm. the property around the pools has a very nice garden, complete with a few palm trees, two small koi ponds and the occasional hummingbird or two. there are also a few areas with tables, chairs and benches for picnicking or just hanging out. if you are a guest you can use the pools as much as you want and they also have some great treatments at the adjoined "oasis spa". it's quiet, clean, comfortable and a nice option for those who want to get the calistoga experience, but don't want to spend top dollar in order to do it. staff are friendly. they provide free coffee in the mornings, outside by the front office. the Roman is very close to Calistoga's main drag with all the shops, cafes, restaurants, etc. in town. it's also close to several other resorts that offer treatments (to note: the "Calistoga Massage Center and Day Spa" is right across the street and offers manicures, pedicures, waxing + some great spa treatments like mineral & mud baths + massages, etc.). crime is seemingly nonexistent in Calistoga, but if safety is a concern for you, the fact that the police station is right across the street kind of makes you worry a bit less than you might otherwise. also, parking is no problem - they have a big parking lot and there is also plenty of all-day, non-metered parking on the street. this was my first time in Calistoga and I would certainly return to this motel. I also met many groups of folks staying there who have been going to Calistoga for years, and they all prefer the Roman!

Reviews.Title: “Bloodhounds”
Reviews.Author: Bloodhounds
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Roman Spa since 1989, a friend took me there and I've been returning lately 4 times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again”
Reviews.Author: Husker_Power
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Roman Spa Hot Springs. Convenient location, comfortable room, and "warm hot springs spa". Took advantage of the Oasis Spa "mud bath" and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and renew at the Roman”
Reviews.Author: pixley_rules
Reviews.Content: We needed a break! And the Roman Spa offers large family suites - two twin beds for our girls (9 and 16) and a king for us in two seperate spacious rooms with a full kitchen. Decent bathroom and nice clean accommodations. But picture this - we all soaked for two hours once we arrived - the three pools accommodate all temperature requirements - from piping hot for the adults, to moderate and warm for the whole family. If you're looking for one of those 'real' spa tubs - large oval tiled ones, not pathetic little modern ones - there's one here! Also you can slip from the hottest into the coolest over the edge - no clambering around in the cold to refresh! Then, the kids opted for pizza in the room, while we walked one block to have a lovely meal and excellent bottle of wine. Finish off the night with more soaks - and start the day the same way and you have yourself a very relaxed crew to start the rush again. This is not the spot for you if you're looking for fancy facilities and pretentious surroundings, but if you want LOCATION, charm and comfort - you'll find it. We'd be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Get-a-Way”
Reviews.Author: WilliamWayne
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Roman Spa. I have not kept count but I would guess that this is our 20 + stay. We usually go twice a year for a family reunion of cousins which Calistoga is pretty central. The help is fantastic. All the way from the office to the maid and grounds men. Friendly, willing to help and very helpful if needed. The facilities are kept in perfect condition. For example, each morning the maid group go around and wipe the outdoor tables and chairs as well as the pool funature of dust and dew. These is a beautiful patio area with eating tables and Weber BBQ [bricketts] as well as a gas cooking facility. These are cleaned daily. Rooms are very clean, made up efficiently and we have never had any problems of any type at the facilities. They have three heated pools, one large outdoor, medium indoor and a hot tub type thing. I'm sure that you could find something less expensive although in my opinon, Roman Spa is not expensive, but you will not find anything with the amenities that it has for the price. [They even have loaner umbrtells in stredgit location when the weather in inclement] Can't wait to go back in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Been Coming for Almost 30 Years to the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Content: Elegant, quiet and clean, that's why we have visited the Roman Spa for nearly 30 years. The variety of the thermal pools allows one to enjoy a wide range of temperatures. This is great! We suggest you come and try this unique place for a great get a way!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go again!”
Reviews.Author: spahog
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Roman Spa in the last year and a half. We stayed eight nights both visits. The cleanliness of the rooms, pools, and grounds are notable. Friendly and responsive staff add much to a visit. The location is great and allows walking to all Calistoga spas, restaurants, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, my gosh!!!!! (translates: perfectly wonderful!!)”
Reviews.Author: Rarelytravel
Reviews.Content: It's not that I'm "easily entertained" or "easy to please", considering 2 factors...#1 I still live in the same town I was born in (Jackson CA) and my daughter that accompanied me...age 16...is 5th generation AND #2 I am a single mom for many years, working part-time to raise my two daughters (oldest is 26, now married, + 3 yr. old grandson also living here!)....Well, on line and in my AAA travel book, Roman Spa Hot Springs looked absolutely beautiful, and I was under the impression the photos weren't taken near the "1 or 2 only tiny garden areas" to deceive us. I believed that the whole facility was to be gorgeous. See, it's been a rare treat to "leave Dodge" on a memorable afforadable get away. And Roman Spa Hot Springs didn't disappoint. We could hardly contain our excitement even at our check in, "we knew" we found the perfect hotel. On the phone and in person, the employees were great, glad we were there. We lacked for nothing visually - every inch of the spacious property was loaded with flowers, trees, and shrubs, inviting umbrella tables (25??) and lounge chairs, 3 pools with varying tempereature degrees of Calistoga Mineral waters. Also, several soothing fountains, nooks and crannies everywhere! The lighting at night was delightful! Our room was amazing, spacious, clean, tastefully decorated. All was quiet and soothing. Someday, we will back. Maybe even "next time". Thank you, Roman Spa Hot Springs for helping make this a blessing my teenager and I will never forget. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “funky and fun!”
Reviews.Author: poopoomanure
Reviews.Content: The must stay place in the wine country...We love it! If you want a low key place to stay with nicely kept grounds, this is it. Three pools / jacuzzi and attentive staff are available. The rooms could use a little updating, but you are within 1-3 blocks walking distance to everything that matters in this area, such as world class dining and wine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: MirandaTravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short last minute stay at the Roman Spa Motel. Room 130 was very clean and the Jacuzzi tub was huge compared to most hotels. The bedding, tub and mattress were a little dated but decent. The staff was extremely helpful in checking us in and out late in order to accommodate our spa treatments. This motel has no frills but it is very comfortable, clean, and the price is reasonable for the area. I do not recommend the Oasis spa however. There are much better facilities in the area about a block away to get wonderful treatments in fantastic spas. The Oasis spa did not offer locker rooms or showers to use before or after massage treatments and the facilities were very average at best. I recommend the Mount View spa or Calistoga Inn and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything from the staff, to location to the pools”
Reviews.Author: Firuzeh
Reviews.Content: I got married on May 28, 2006. What I wanted more than anything from my wedding was space and time for my family and friends to be together and enjoy their time and each other. I did not want a few quick hours where I would not be able to see half of my loved ones. Well, the Roman Spa was the place that made this happen. We booked about 45 of the 60 rooms at the place. The staff spent hours coordinating the rooms with me which seemed to change daily up to the wedding day. While we were at the resort, the staff was kind, easy-going and so accomidating. I was worried that our crazy friends would get us in trouble but it worked out so great. The pools were great, the kids loved it. The resort is centrally located to most spots in town and the wine country. The other guests included a group of fun and sweet Russians who are regulars at the spa. The place has a home-away-from-home feel to it. The rooms were super clean and no one claimed the rooms to be newer than they were. Even when I noticed my wedding dress was missing after unpacking my car, the staff helped me locate it. For other reviewers who complained about the price, I would like to say that chain hotels in the area such as the Best Western off the highway, are not any cheaper and a lot less fun and personable. These are the prices of Napa Valley. So in short, we all loved the Roman Spa, its amenties and staff and even enterntained the idea of having another get togheter there soon.

Reviews.Title: “girls weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roman Spa for a weekend getaway last weekend. Although the weather was a little warm the pools were relaxing and the flowering gardens were a delight. A comfortable place for four women to getaway with little hassle and easy access to wineries and everything downtown. For an older establishment it is well maintained, the rooms really really clean. The front desk staff was friendly and helped with all of our questions and many requests. We will return with friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful mini getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Roman Spa you feel the wonderful pleasent atmosphere right away. The pools were very relaxing. Even though I only spent one day I left feeling I was on vacation for an entire week. The service was quite up to par especially the manager Pauline. She was so friendly and knew so much about the area. Roman Spa is a place you must visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Rejuvenate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a relaxing place to go to rejuvenate, the Roman Spa in Calistoga Ca is the place to go. The atmosphere is quaint and peaceful. The Staff is always friendly and attentive. I would highly recommend this hide away Spa to anyone looking for that perfect City escape.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Roman Spa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is a favorite. I have gone to the Roman Spa several times for a romantic weekend. The lush foliage gives the Roman Spa a tropical peaceful ambiance. It is especially beautiful during the holidays. I have also visited the Roman Spa Mother's Day weekend with my mother and sister. The staff was so accomodating. My sister had broken her leg a couple of weeks earlier and the weekend proved to be a bit much for her. The Roman Spa provided a wheel chair, not only for getting around the resort, but for getting to dinner and around town as well. I've even taken my young niece and nephew, who are preteens, to the Roman Spa for an unforgettable weekend. They loved the warm pools. Great restaurants and shopping are all close by. Calistoga is a fun little getaway and the Roman Spa is a special place to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “It's the service, stupid!”
Reviews.Author: Adriana050
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roman spa ths weekend and was deeply disappointed. For $200 a night I expect a little more than your average stay at a Motel 6, but that was not the case here. The room was clean, but no more than that. Beds are uncomfortable, the maids don't bother with fresh sheets or towels, there was no iron in the room and not even a can opener that worked in the kitchen. Also, the pools were filthy dirty. When I called to complain about the pool, the young woman who answered the phone snorted at me and said "I have no idea why you are calling and telling me this, no one else has complained!" I asked to speak to a manager on Saturday and was first told that she would be at 10:00 am. I went in to the office after 10:00 a.m. and was told no manager would be available until Monday. Why would you run a "resort" with no manager on site during the month of August? I called on Monday, and was told there was no manager in on Mondays! Again, no service seems to be the mantra at the Roman Spa. I do not know where the Roman Spa gets their staff, but as a small business owner, I would never put up with rude staff. I have stayed at many hotels throughout the world, and many in the Nape Valley and I can honestly say that good service can over come many flaws in the hotel busness. The Roman Spa has many flaws and they do not even attempt to address them, let alone provide the service for which people are paying.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Roman Spa motel over the Fourth of July, and we found it to be a good value. Our room was clean and the grounds were well-maintained. The small outdoor pool and indoor jacuzzi were relaxing after a long day of wine-tasting! The motel is well-located, within easy walking distance of most Calistoga restaurants and shops. I noticed that some of the other reviews complain about unaccommodating staff at the front desk, but everyone we encountered was helpful and pleasant.
